<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="38%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4. To hold an advisory vote on the frequency of holding an advisory vote on executive compensation; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="38%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5. To approve an Amendment to our 2007 Long-Term Incentive Plan; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="38%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6. To consider a Proposal from a shareholder recommending that our Board of Directors amend the Company&#146;s Bylaws (and each appropriate document) to
give holders of 10% or more of the Company&#146;s outstanding common stock (or the lowest percentage permitted by law above 10%) the power to call a special shareholder meeting; and </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="38%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7. To transact any other business that may properly come before the meeting. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="38%"> <P STYLE="margin-bottom:1px; margin-left:2%; text-indent:-2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">RECORD DATE </FONT></P></TD>
<TD><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">You must own Office Depot voting securities of record as of the close of business on March 3, 2011 to attend and vote at our Annual Meeting of Shareholders and any adjournment thereof.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="38%"> <P STYLE="margin-bottom:1px; margin-left:2%; text-indent:-2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ANNUAL REPORT </FONT></P></TD>
<TD><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our 2010 Annual Report on Form 10-K is enclosed with these proxy materials. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV ALIGN="right">

<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Elisa D. Garcia C.</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Executive Vice President, General Counsel&nbsp;&amp;</I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Corporate Secretary</I></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Boca Raton, Florida </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">March&nbsp;10, 2011 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Please
note that for security reasons, we will require that you present the admission ticket included with this Proxy Statement and a positive picture identification if you attend our Annual Meeting. We reserve the right to exclude any person whose name
does not appear on our official shareholder list as of our record date of March&nbsp;3, 2011. If you hold shares in &#147;street name&#148; and do not have a ticket, you must bring a letter from your stockbroker, or a current brokerage statement, to
indicate that the broker is holding shares for your benefit. We also reserve the right to request any person to leave the Annual Meeting who is disruptive, refuses to follow the rules established for the meeting or for any other reason. Cameras,
recording devices and other electronic devices, signs and placards will NOT be permitted at the meeting. </B></FONT></P>

<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ii </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>PROXY STATEMENT </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>FOR THE </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>2011 ANNUAL MEETING OF SHAREHOLDERS </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>OF OFFICE DEPOT, INC. </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>6600 North Military Trail </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Boca Raton, Florida 33496 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Telephone (561)&nbsp;438-4800 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>This Proxy Statement is solicited on
behalf of the Board of Directors of Office Depot, Inc. (&#147;Office Depot&#148; or the &#147;Company&#148;). This Proxy Statement contains important information about our 2011 Annual Meeting of Shareholders to be held on April&nbsp;21, 2011
(&#147;Annual Meeting&#148;), at 8:30 a.m. Eastern Daylight Time, at the Boca Raton Marriott at Boca Center, 5150 Town Center Circle, Boca Raton, Florida 33486. We are providing this Proxy Statement and accompanying proxy card to our shareholders on
or about March&nbsp;10, 2011. Our shareholders of record are invited to attend the Annual Meeting and are requested to vote on the proposals described in this Proxy Statement. </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><A NAME="tx145578_1"></A><B>Purposes of the Meeting.</B>&nbsp;Important matters outlined in the Notice of this Meeting will be considered
at our Annual Meeting. We have provided these proxy materials to you in connection with the solicitation of proxies by our board of directors (&#147;Board of Directors&#148; or &#147;Board&#148;, or individually, each a &#147;Director&#148;). Our
Board of Directors asks that you authorize your proxies to vote as our Board of Directors recommends. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><A NAME="tx145578_2"></A><B>Notice of Electronic Availability of Proxy Statement and Annual Report on Form 10-K.</B> As permitted by
rules adopted by the Securities and Exchange Commission (the &#147;SEC&#148;), Office Depot is making this Proxy Statement and our Annual Report on Form 10-K available to its shareholders electronically via the Internet. You may access these
materials at www.proxyvote.com. On or about March&nbsp;10, 2011, we will mail to our U.S. and Canadian shareholders this Proxy Statement, our 2010 Annual Report on Form 10-K and proxy card. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><A NAME="tx145578_3"></A><B>Voting Your Shares.</B>&nbsp;You may vote your shares in one of the following ways: (1)&nbsp;in person at the
Annual Meeting; (2)&nbsp;by completing, signing and returning your proxy card to us in the enclosed postage-paid envelope; (3)&nbsp;by voting electronically using a touch-tone telephone at 800-690-6903; or (4)&nbsp;by using the Internet to vote your
shares at www.proxyvote.com. If your shares are held in &#147;street name&#148; with a broker or similar party, you will need to contact your broker to determine whether you will be able to vote using one of these alternative methods. If you vote
over the Internet, you may incur costs such as telephone and Internet access charges for which you will be responsible. If you choose to use the Internet or telephone to vote, you must do so <U>by 6:00&nbsp;p.m. </U>Eastern Daylight Time on
<U>April&nbsp;20, 2011</U>, the day before our Annual Meeting takes place. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Delaware law permits electronically transmitted
proxies, provided that each such proxy contains or is submitted with information from which the inspectors of election can determine that such proxy was authorized by the shareholder. The voting procedures available to registered shareholders for
the Annual Meeting are designed to authenticate each shareholder by use of a control number, to allow shareholders to vote their shares, and to confirm that their instructions have been properly recorded. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>OUR BOARD OF DIRECTORS RECOMMENDS: </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>We also strongly urge you to vote by means of the telephone or the Internet as this allows for automatic tally of your votes and also
saves Office Depot the cost of return postage.&nbsp; However you choose to vote, we urge you to VOTE as early as possible. </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><A NAME="tx145578_4"></A><B>Proxies.</B>&nbsp;Our Board of Directors has appointed certain persons (&#147;proxies&#148;) to vote proxy
shares in accordance with the instructions of our shareholders. If you authorize the proxies to vote your shares, but do NOT specify how your shares should be voted, they will vote your shares as our Board of Directors recommends. If any other
matters are presented for consideration at our Annual Meeting, your shares also will be voted as our Board of Directors recommends. You can change or revoke your proxy: (1)&nbsp;by mailing your request to our Corporate Secretary at our corporate
headquarters, at 6600 North Military Trail, Boca Raton, FL 33496, so that it is received not later than 4:00&nbsp;p.m. Eastern Daylight Time, on April&nbsp;20, 2011; (2)&nbsp;by filing a proxy with a later date; or (3)&nbsp;by voting your shares by
ballot in person at the Annual Meeting. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><A NAME="tx145578_5"></A><B>Solicitation of Proxies.</B>&nbsp;In addition to
soliciting proxies by mail, we also may solicit proxies in person, by telephone or over the Internet. Our employees do not receive additional compensation for their solicitation services. Certain banking institutions, brokerage firms, custodians,
trustees, nominees and fiduciaries who hold shares for the benefit of another party (the &#147;beneficial owner&#148;) may solicit proxies for us. If so, they will mail proxy information to, or otherwise communicate with, the beneficial owners of
shares of our common stock held by them. We also have hired Morrow&nbsp;&amp; Co., LLC to assist us in communicating with these institutions and forwarding solicitation materials to them, and we have agreed to pay Morrow&nbsp;&amp; Co., LLC a fee of
$12,000 plus reimbursement of its reasonable out-of-pocket expenses in connection with this service. We will also reimburse brokerage firms and other custodians, nominees and fiduciaries for their expenses incurred in sending proxies and proxy
materials to beneficial owners of our common stock. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><A NAME="tx145578_6"></A><B>Shareholders Eligible to Vote at Our Annual
Meeting; List of Shareholders Available.</B>&nbsp;Owners of our voting securities as of the close of business on March&nbsp;3, 2011 (the &#147;Record Date&#148;) will be entitled to vote at our Annual Meeting. Our official stock ownership records
will conclusively determine whether you are a &#147;holder of record&#148; as of the Record Date. A list of shareholders entitled to vote at the meeting will be available at our Annual Meeting and for ten days prior to the meeting between the hours
of 9:00&nbsp;a.m. and 4:00&nbsp;p.m. Eastern Daylight Time at our corporate headquarters in Boca Raton, Florida. As of March&nbsp;3, 2011, there were 277,436,190&nbsp;shares of common stock outstanding and owned by shareholders (i.e., excluding
shares held in treasury by Office Depot). Each share of common stock is entitled to one vote on each matter considered at our Annual Meeting. In addition, as of March&nbsp;3, 2011, there were 274,596 shares of 10% Series A Redeemable Convertible
Participating Perpetual Preferred Stock, par value $0.01 per share and 75,404 shares of 10% Series B Redeemable Conditional Convertible Participating Perpetual Preferred Stock, par value $0.01 per share,&nbsp;outstanding which in the aggregate are
entitled to 73,703,194 votes. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><A NAME="tx145578_7"></A><B>Establishing a Quorum.</B>&nbsp;In order for us to transact
business at our Annual Meeting, the holders of the majority of the outstanding voting securities must be present, either in person or by proxy. Shareholders choosing to abstain from voting and broker &#147;non-votes&#148; will be treated as present
and entitled to vote for purposes of determining whether a quorum is present. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><A NAME="tx145578_8"></A><B>Effect of
Abstentions and Broker Non-Votes.</B>&nbsp;Brokers who hold shares for the accounts of their clients may vote such shares either as directed by their clients or in their own discretion as permitted under the listing rules of the New York Stock
Exchange. For purposes of the 2011 Annual Meeting, brokers are permitted to vote their clients&#146; proxies in their own discretion as to the ratification of the appointment of the independent registered public accounting firm if the clients have
not furnished voting instructions 10 days prior to the meeting. All </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">
proposals other than the ratification of the appointment of the independent registered public accounting firm, are &#147;non-discretionary&#148; and brokers who have received no instructions from
their clients do not have discretion to vote on those items. When a broker votes a client&#146;s shares on some but not all of the proposals at a meeting, the missing votes are referred to as broker &#147;non-votes.&#148; Abstentions and broker
&#147;non-votes&#148; will not be counted as a vote &#147;for&#148; or &#147;against&#148; any matter. Broker non-votes will not be counted as shares entitled to vote and accordingly will not affect the outcome with respect to any matter to be voted
on at the Annual Meeting. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><A NAME="tx145578_9"></A><B>Householding of Annual Disclosure Documents. </B>Two or more
shareholders sharing an address can request delivery of a single copy of our annual disclosure documents if they are receiving multiple copies by calling Broadridge at (800)&nbsp;542-1061 or writing to them at Householding Department,
51&nbsp;Mercedes Way, Edgewood, NY 11717. In the same way, two or more shareholders sharing an address and receiving only a single copy of the annual disclosure documents can request to each receive a separate copy of the disclosure documents. If a
broker or other nominee holds your shares, please contact Broadridge and inform them of your request by calling them at (800)&nbsp;542-1061 or writing to them at Householding Department, 51&nbsp;Mercedes Way, Edgewood, NY 11717. Please be sure to
include your name, the name of your brokerage firm, and your account number. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="tx145578_10"></A>Required Vote.
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Election of Directors. </I>In an uncontested election, each nominee must be elected by a majority of the votes cast.
This means that the number of votes cast &#147;FOR&#148; a nominee must exceed the number of votes cast &#147;AGAINST&#148; the nominee. A properly executed proxy marked &#147;ABSTAIN&#148; with respect to the election of one or more Directors or
shares held by a broker for which voting instructions have not been given will not be voted with respect to the Director or Directors indicated, although it will be counted for purposes of determining whether a quorum is present. In a contested
election (an election in which the number of candidates exceeds the number of director positions to be filled), the number of Director nominees that equals the number of director positions to be filled receiving the greatest number of votes cast
will be elected as Directors. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Ratification of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm</I>. Pursuant to the
Company&#146;s Amended and Restated Bylaws (&#147;Bylaws&#148;), ratification of the Company&#146;s independent registered public accounting firm requires that a majority of the votes cast at the Annual Meeting be voted &#147;FOR&#148; the proposal.
A properly executed proxy marked &#147;ABSTAIN&#148; with respect to this proposal will not be counted as a vote cast &#147;FOR&#148; or &#147;AGAINST&#148; that proposal. Thus, abstentions will not affect the outcome with respect to this matter.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Other Matters</I>. Other than proposals that are subject to advisory votes, pursuant to the Company&#146;s Bylaws,
approval of any other proposal to be voted upon at the Annual Meeting requires a majority of the votes present in person or represented by proxy (as counted for purposes of determining the existence of a quorum) and entitled to vote at the Annual
Meeting to be voted &#147;FOR&#148; the proposal. Accordingly, abstentions and broker non-votes will be counted as votes &#147;AGAINST&#148; the proposal. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="tx145578_11"></A>MATTERS TO BE CONSIDERED BY OUR SHAREHOLDERS </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="tx145578_12"></A>ITEM&nbsp;1: ELECTION OF DIRECTORS </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><A NAME="tx145578_13"></A>Nominees for Directors of Office Depot </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">At
the 2011 Annual Meeting, the eleven (11) directors nominated below are to be elected to hold office until the 2012 Annual Meeting and until their successors have been elected and qualified. The eleven (11) nominees for election at the 2011 Annual
Meeting are all currently Directors of the Company. The Company&#146;s Board of Directors has determined that ten (10) nominees satisfy the New York Stock Exchange&#146;s (the &#147;NYSE&#148;) definition of independent director. We do not know of
any reason why any nominee would be unable to serve as a Director. If any nominee is unable to serve, the shares represented by all valid proxies will be voted for the election of such other person as the Board may nominate. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Neil R. Austrian*</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">David I. Fuente</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Kathleen Mason</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Justin Bateman</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Brenda J. Gaines</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">James S. Rubin</FONT></TD></TR>

<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Thomas J. Colligan</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Myra M. Hart</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Raymond Svider</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Marsha J. Evans</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">W. Scott Hedrick</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="line-height:8px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000;width:10%">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">*</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;Austrian is serving as our Interim Chair and Chief Executive Officer while the Company searches for a new chief executive officer. While serving in his current
position, Mr.&nbsp;Austrian is not &#147;independent,&#148; however, pursuant to the NYSE listing rules, service as an interim chief executive officer will not disqualify Mr.&nbsp;Austrian from being considered independent following the completion
of his interim employment. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Subject to our Corporate Governance Guidelines discussed below in the section
captioned &#147;Corporate Governance,&#148; the eleven (11)&nbsp;nominees for the office of Director will be elected by majority vote. In an uncontested election, each Director nominee must be elected by a majority of the votes cast. This means that
the number of votes cast &#147;FOR&#148; a Director nominee must exceed the number of votes cast &#147;AGAINST&#148; the nominee. Pursuant to the Company&#146;s Bylaws, abstentions are not considered to be &#147;votes cast&#148; therefore an
abstention will have no effect on the election of Directors. In a contested election&nbsp;(an election in which the number of candidates exceeds the number of director positions to be filled), the number of Director nominees that equals the number
of director positions to be filled receiving the greatest number of votes cast will be elected as Directors. All of our Directors form a single class of Directors and stand for election each year. Information about the nominees, their business
experience and other relevant biographical information is set forth in the following section. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Should any of these nominees
become unable to serve, our Corporate Governance&nbsp;and Nominating Committee may propose a substitute nominee. If a substitute nominee is named, all proxies voting FOR the nominee who is unable to serve will be voted for the substitute nominee so
named. If a substitute nominee is not named, all proxies will be voted for the election of the remaining nominees (or as directed on your proxy card). In no event will more than eleven (11)&nbsp;Directors be elected at our 2011 Annual Meeting. Each
person nominated for election has agreed to serve if elected and management has no reason to believe that any nominee will be unable to serve. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Pursuant to Article&nbsp;II, Section&nbsp;9 of our Bylaws, in any uncontested election of directors, any Director who is an &#147;incumbent&#148; Director who does not receive a greater number of votes
cast &#147;FOR&#148; his or her election than votes cast &#147;AGAINST&#148; his or her election must immediately tender his or her resignation to the Board of Directors. After the Director tenders his or her resignation, the Board of Directors must
then decide within 90&nbsp;days of the date the Director submitted his or her resignation, through a process managed by the Corporate Governance&nbsp;and Nominating Committee (and excluding the Director in question from all Board of Directors and
Committee deliberations), whether to accept the Director&#146;s resignation. Absent a compelling reason, as determined by the Board of Directors, for the Director to remain on the Board, the Board of Directors shall accept the Director&#146;s
resignation. If the Board of Directors determines that there is a compelling reason for the Director to remain on the Board and does not accept the Director&#146;s resignation, the Board must publicly disclose its decision either in a Current Report
on Form&nbsp;8-K filed with the SEC or in a press release. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If the Board of Directors accepts an incumbent Director&#146;s resignation, that Director
will immediately cease to be a member of the Board of Directors. If the Board of Directors does not accept an incumbent Director&#146;s resignation, that Director will continue to serve until the next annual meeting of shareholders, or until the
earlier of his or her subsequent resignation or removal. If a Director nominee who was not already serving as an incumbent Director is not elected at the annual meeting, under Delaware law and our Bylaws, that Director nominee would not become a
director and would not serve on the Board of Directors as a &#147;holdover director.&#148; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>YOUR BOARD OF DIRECTORS RECOMMENDS A
VOTE&nbsp;&#147;FOR&#148; THE ELECTION OF EACH OF THE NOMINEES LISTED IN ITEM&nbsp;1 ON YOUR PROXY CARD. </B></FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5 </FONT></P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="tx145578_14"></A>BIOGRAPHICAL INFORMATION ON THE NOMINEES </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="47%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>NEIL R. AUSTRIAN</I></B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>AGE: 71</I></B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;Austrian has served as a Director on our Board since 1998. As Interim Chair and Chief Executive Officer (&#147;Interim Chair and
CEO&#148;) of the Company, Mr.&nbsp;Austrian has in-depth insights into the Company&#146;s operations and its management which uniquely qualifies him for serving on our Company&#146;s Board. Mr.&nbsp;Austrian has served in this interim role since
November 2010 and previously served in this role from October 2004 through March 2005. In addition, Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s experience as President and Chief Operating Officer of the National Football League from April 1991 until December 1999,
makes him well suited to understand and oversee the complex managerial, strategic and financial considerations necessary to serve on the board of a corporation such as Office Depot. His experience at Dillon Reed&nbsp;&amp; Co. Inc. as Managing
Director from October 1987 until March 1991 provided him with a sound footing in finance, investment banking and deal negotiation. In addition, Mr.&nbsp;Austrian served as the Chief Financial Officer of Doyle Berbach Advertising, a public
advertising agency, from 1974 until 1978, which enhanced his finance and strategic experience. Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s knowledge of all aspects of the business gained while serving as a director of Viking Office Products from 1988 until August 1998
when it merged with Office Depot, further strengthens his knowledge of our industry. Mr.&nbsp;Austrian also serves as a director of the Direct TV Group (formerly Hughes Electronics Company). </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>JUSTIN BATEMAN</I></B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>AGE: 37</I></B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;Bateman has served as a Director on our Board since June 2009. He is a Partner with BC Partners, the U.S. investment arm of which
he co-established in early 2008, and is based in the firm&#146;s New York office. Mr.&nbsp;Bateman initially joined BC Partners&#146; London office in 2000 from PricewaterhouseCoopers, where he spent three years in Transaction Services working on
due diligence projects for both financial investors and corporate clients. In 2002 he left BC Partners to complete his MBA at INSEAD before rejoining the BC Partners London office. Over the years Mr.&nbsp;Bateman has participated in or been a board
member of General Healthcare Group, Baxi Holdings, Ltd. and Regency Entertainment. He is currently a director of Intelsat S.A., the leading international provider of fixed satellite services. Mr.&nbsp;Bateman was appointed as a Director of the
Company pursuant to the terms of the Investor Rights Agreement in connection with the Company&#146;s private equity investment transaction with BC Partners. Mr.&nbsp;Bateman serves as a non-voting observer on the Audit Committee and his experience
as a chartered accountant and understanding of accounting issues is helpful in fulfilling the committee&#146;s oversight responsibilities. Mr.&nbsp;Bateman&#146;s analysis of and participation in the oversight of BC Partners portfolio companies
provides him with the skills he needs to assist the Company with its strategic planning process. Mr.&nbsp;Bateman&#146;s education and experience in business and finance allows him to provide the Board significant managerial, strategic, financial
and compliance-based expertise. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>AGE: 66</I></B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;Colligan has served as a Director on our Board since January 2010. He served as Vice Dean of The Wharton School&#146;s Aresty
Institute of Executive Education from 2007 to June 2010 where he was responsible for the non-degree executive education programs. From 2004 to 2007, Mr.&nbsp;Colligan served as a managing director at Duke Corporate Education, a corporation that
provides custom executive education and is affiliated with Duke University&#146;s Fuqua School of Business. Prior to joining Duke Corporate Education, he was Vice Chairman of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP from 2001 to 2004 and served there in other
capacities from 1969 to 2004, including as a partner. Mr.&nbsp;Colligan also has advised Fortune 500 companies in various industries, including technology, telecommunications, pharmaceuticals and consumer products. Mr.&nbsp;Colligan is currently a
director of CNH Global, N.V., and Targus Group International, Inc., a non-public company and leading global supplier of notebook carrying cases and accessories. He previously served as a director of Schering-Plough Corporation, Anesiva, Inc. and
Educational Management Corporation. Mr.&nbsp;Colligan&#146;s experience as a former audit partner and Vice Chairman of PricewaterhouseCoopers qualifies him to serve on the Board of Directors and to provide guidance to the Company&#146;s internal
audit function. In addition, Mr.&nbsp;Colligan&#146;s former position as Vice Dean of </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6 </FONT></P>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>AGE: 63</I></B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Ms.&nbsp;Evans has served as a Director on our Board since 2006. Ms.&nbsp;Evans was acting Commissioner of the Ladies Professional Golf
Association from July 2009 to January 2010, President and Chief Executive Officer of the American Red Cross from 2002 to 2005, and National Executive Director of The Girl Scouts of the USA from 1998 to 2002. Ms.&nbsp;Evans retired from the
U.S.&nbsp;Navy in 1998 with the rank of Rear Admiral. From 1995 to 1998 Ms.&nbsp;Evans served as superintendent of the Naval Postgraduate School in Monterey, California and from 1993 to 1995 she led the Navy&#146;s worldwide recruitment
organization, during which time she developed extensive human resources experience. Currently, she is also a Director of Huntsman Corporation, Weight Watchers International, North Highland and The Estate of Lehman Brothers Holdings. Ms.&nbsp;Evans
brings significant leadership experience to our Board of Directors and the Board relies on her perspectives on human resources and governance issues. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;Fuente has been a Director on our Board since he joined Office Depot in 1987. Until December 2001, he served as Chair of our
Board of Directors. From December 1987 until July 2000, Mr.&nbsp;Fuente also served as Chief Executive Officer of our Company. As Office Depot&#146;s former Chief Executive Officer, Mr.&nbsp;Fuente contributed significantly to the development of the
Company from its inception. He is familiar with all aspects of the Company including its management, operations and financial requirements and demonstrates a practical understanding of organizations, processes, strategy, risk management and the
methods to drive change and growth. Mr.&nbsp;Fuente&#146;s role and experience in the early development of the Company has provided the Company certain continuity in its operational and financial management. Mr.&nbsp;Fuente is the Chairman of the G
100, a think tank of chief executive officers and business leaders. He is also a Director of Ryder System, Inc. and Dick&#146;s Sporting Goods. His experience as a board member and as a former Chief Executive Officer of our Company, as well as his
financial expertise bring unique skills to our Board of Directors. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>BRENDA J. GAINES</I></B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>AGE: 61</I></B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Ms.&nbsp;Gaines has been a Director on our Board since 2002. Ms.&nbsp;Gaines retired in 2004 from her position as President and Chief
Executive Officer of Diners Club North America, a Division of Citigroup, a position she held since 2002. She served as President of Diners Club North America from 1999 until 2002 and from 1994 until 1999, she served as Executive Vice President,
Corporate Card Sales. Prior to that she served in various positions of increasing responsibility within Citigroup or its predecessor corporations since 1988. From 1985 until 1987, Ms.&nbsp;Gaines was Deputy Chief of Staff for the Mayor of the City
of Chicago. She is currently a director of NICOR, Inc., the Federal National Mortgage Association (Fannie Mae) and Tenet Healthcare Corporation, and is on the National Board of the Smithsonian Institution. Ms.&nbsp;Gaines also served as a director
of CNA Financial Corp. from 2004 to 2007 and has served as a board member of the non-profit organization March of Dimes. Ms.&nbsp;Gaines has significant experience in financial services, including the credit card and payment industry. As Chief
Executive Officer of Diners Club North America, she managed a company with three distinct customer groups, that included retail consumers, small businesses and large multinational corporations. While working as the Deputy Chief of Staff for the
Mayor of the City of Chicago, Ms.&nbsp;Gaines developed valuable experience working with public agencies, which represent one of the Company&#146;s larger customer segments. This experience enables her to provide insights into the Company&#146;s
core customers as well as the Company&#146;s products and services. Ms.&nbsp;Gaines has held a number of executive and board leadership positions in a number of public companies. Ms.&nbsp;Gaines&#146; service on other public company boards allows
her to provide the Board of Directors with a variety of perspectives on corporate governance issues. </FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Dr.&nbsp;Hart has served as a Director on our Board since 2004. She is currently a member of Harvard Business School&#146;s senior
faculty. From 1995 to 2007, she served as Professor, Entrepreneurial Management, at the Harvard Business School. In 2007 and 2008, she was a visiting scholar at Babson College and Stanford University, respectively. From 1985 until 1990,
Dr.&nbsp;Hart was a member of the Staples, Inc. founding management team, leading operations, strategic planning and growth implementation in new and existing markets. She is a Director of Nina McLemore, Inc. and Kraft Foods, Inc. and a former
director of Summer Infant, Inc. and Royal Aloha. Dr.&nbsp;Hart is also a member of the National Board of the Smithsonian Institution, and a Trustee Emeritus of Cornell University. Dr.&nbsp;Hart&#146;s experience as a member of the founding
management team of Staples, Inc. enables her to share with our Board suggestions about how similarly-situated companies effectively assess and undertake business considerations and opportunities. In addition, as a member of Harvard Business
School&#146;s senior faculty, Dr.&nbsp;Hart has been able to offer Office Depot a variety of business and management solutions that are grounded in proven policies and practices taught at the business school. Dr.&nbsp;Hart&#146;s service on other
public, private and non-profit boards also provides our Board with a diverse knowledge of best practices. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

Inc., which was acquired by Office Depot in 1991. Mr.&nbsp;Hedrick was appointed Lead Director in February 2011. He was a founder and has been a general partner of InterWest Partners, a venture capital fund, since 1979. Mr.&nbsp;Hedrick is also a

Morning Corporation and has served in that position since July 2000. From July 1999 to November 1999, Ms.&nbsp;Mason served as President of Filene&#146;s Basement, a department store chain. From January 1997 to June 1999, Ms.&nbsp;Mason was
President of HomeGoods, an off-price home fashion store and a subsidiary of TJX Companies. Ms.&nbsp;Mason was Chair and Chief Executive Officer of Cherry&nbsp;&amp; Webb, a women&#146;s specialty store, from February 1987 to December 1996. Prior to

Warehouse, Inc., and of Hot Topic, Inc. Ms.&nbsp;Mason&#146;s senior executive positions at various large national retail companies gives her the experience to critically review the various business considerations necessary to run a successful
consumer-driven business such as our North American Retail Division. Ms.&nbsp;Mason&#146;s broad exposure to numerous retailers provides our Board with relevant comparisons and her extensive retail knowledge gives her an insight into a number of
issues facing Office Depot. As a sitting chief executive officer of a public retail company, Ms.&nbsp;Mason is able to offer our Board of Directors sound business and financial strategies to address evolving complex audit issues. </FONT></P>

responsible for building One Equity&#146;s practice in India. Prior to forming One Equity, Mr.&nbsp;Rubin was a Vice President with Allen&nbsp;&amp; Company Incorporated, a New York </FONT></P>

Mr.&nbsp;Rubin is currently a board member of ATI Enterprises, a private post-secondary education company, and MultiPlan, one of the largest independent preferred provider organizations in the U.S. He is a member of the board of trustees of the

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>RAYMOND SVIDER</I></B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>AGE: 48</I></B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;Svider has served as a Director on our Board since June 2009. He has been co-Chairman of BC Partners since December 2008 and has
been a Managing Partner of the firm since 2003. Mr.&nbsp;Svider joined BC Partners in 1992 in Paris before moving to London in 2000 to lead its investments in the technology and telecoms industries. Over the years, Mr.&nbsp;Svider has participated
in or led a variety of investments including Tubesca, Nutreco, UTL, Neopost, Polyconcept, Neuf Telecom, Unity Media/Tele Columbus, and Intelsat S.A. He is currently Chairman of the board, the audit and compensation committees of Intelsat S.A., and a
member of the board of ATI Enterprises, a private post-secondary education company, and MultiPlan, one of the largest independent preferred provider organizations in the U.S. Prior to joining BC Partners, Mr.&nbsp;Svider worked in investment banking
at Wasserstein Perella in New York and Paris, and at the Boston Consulting Group in Chicago. Mr.&nbsp;Svider was appointed as a Director on our Board pursuant to the terms of the Investor Rights Agreement in connection with the Company&#146;s
private equity investment transaction with BC Partners. As a Managing Partner of BC Partners since 2003, Mr.&nbsp;Svider has demonstrated significant leadership abilities and extensive knowledge of complex financial and operational issues facing
large organizations. He brings an expertise in international operations and financial strategy to our Board of Directors. In addition, through his oversight of BC Partners portfolio companies, Mr.&nbsp;Svider has significant experience in developing
various strategies to motivate and compensate executives. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">9 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="tx145578_15"></A>CORPORATE GOVERNANCE </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><A NAME="tx145578_16"></A>Corporate Governance Guidelines </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We have a strong commitment to good corporate governance practices and the independence of our Board of Directors from our management. These practices provide a framework within which the Board of
Directors and management can pursue our strategic objectives and ensure long-term growth for the benefit of our shareholders. Our Corporate Governance Guidelines may be viewed at our corporate web site, <I>www.officedepot.com</I> under the headings
&#147;Company Information/Investor Relations/Corporate Governance.&#148; In addition, a printed copy of our Corporate Governance Guidelines will be provided to any shareholder upon written request to our Corporate Secretary. The Corporate Governance
and Nominating Committee reviews the guidelines annually and any changes are recommended to the Board of Directors for approval. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><A NAME="tx145578_17">
</A>Board Leadership Structure </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Effective November&nbsp;1, 2010, Mr.&nbsp;Stephen A. Odland resigned as Chair and Chief
Executive Officer of the Company (&#147;former Chair and CEO&#148;) and Mr. Neil R. Austrian was appointed as the Company&#146;s Interim Chair and CEO until the Company finds a permanent replacement. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Prior to his resignation, Mr.&nbsp;Odland was required to serve as both Chair and Chief Executive Officer pursuant to the duties outlined
in his employment agreement. Mr.&nbsp;Odland&#146;s combined role as Chair and Chief Executive Officer promoted unified leadership and direction for the Board of Directors and executive management and it allowed for a single, clear focus for the
chain of command to execute the Company&#146;s strategic initiatives and business plans. Prior to Mr.&nbsp;Odland&#146;s resignation, Mr.&nbsp;Austrian served as our Lead Director. As Lead Director, Mr.&nbsp;Austrian had the following
duties:</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">preside at all meetings of the Board of Directors where the Chair of the Board is not present; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">preside at all executive sessions of the independent Directors; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">call meetings of the independent Directors, as needed; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">meet regularly with the Chief Executive Officer (&#147;CEO&#148;); </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>

<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">review information sent to the Board of Directors; and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">meet with shareholders as appropriate. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In order to ensure continuity during the search for a permanent CEO, the Company chose not to separate the positions of Chair and CEO. As a result of Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s current position as Interim
Chair and CEO, Mr.&nbsp;Austrian no longer serves as Lead Director. On February 16, 2010, the Board appointed Mr. Scott Hedrick to serve as Lead Director, to perform the duties described above. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In the future, consistent with the Company&#146;s Corporate Governance Guidelines it is the Board of Director&#146;s intention to
separate the positions of Chair and CEO and that the position of Chair shall be held by an independent director on the Board of Directors. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><A NAME="tx145578_18"></A>Director Independence </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Board of Directors believes in strong and independent Directors. The Board of Directors evaluates the independence of each nominee for election as a Director of our Company in accordance with the
Corporate Governance Guidelines, which incorporate the applicable listing standards of the NYSE. The Corporate </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">10 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">
Governance Guidelines require that a majority of our Board of Directors must be &#147;Independent&#148; within the meaning of the NYSE&#146;s listing standards (&#147;Independent
Directors&#148;), and all Directors who sit on our Audit Committee, Compensation Committee and Corporate Governance&nbsp;and Nominating Committee, must also be Independent Directors. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">All members of our Audit Committee, Compensation Committee and Corporate Governance&nbsp;and Nominating Committee have been determined by
our Board of Directors to be Independent Directors. Our Board of Directors has reviewed the various relationships between members of our Board of Directors and the Company and has affirmatively determined that none of our Directors has a material
relationship with the Company, other than Mr.&nbsp;Austrian, who is currently serving as our Interim Chair and CEO until a permanent replacement is appointed. Mr.&nbsp;Austrian is also a member of the Finance Committee of our Board of Directors. Our
Board of Directors has also determined that Messrs. Bateman, Rubin and Svider are affiliates of the Company due to BC Partners&#146; stock ownership of the Company. The Board of Directors concluded that a relationship with a shareholder of the
Company in and of itself does not impair Messrs. Bateman, Rubin and Svider&#146;s independent judgment in connection with their duties and responsibilities as Directors of the Company. The Board also determined that Mr.&nbsp;Colligan, who serves as
a director of an entity that sells products to the Company, is independent. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As a result, all members of our Board of
Directors other than Mr.&nbsp;Austrian, due to his interim CEO position, have been determined to be Independent Directors. This determination by our Board of Directors is based upon an individual evaluation of each of our Directors, his or her
employment or board of directors affiliations, and a determination that the Independent Director has no business relationship with our Company other than his or her service on our Board of Directors. None of our Directors serves as an executive
officer of a charitable organization to which we made contributions during 2010. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><A NAME="tx145578_19"></A>Board of Directors&#146;
Role in Risk Oversight </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our Board of Directors has an active role in overseeing management of the Company&#146;s risks,
directly and through its committees. The Board oversees a formal enterprise-wide approach to risk management, designed to support the achievement of organizational objectives, including strategic objectives, to improve long-term organizational
performance and enhance shareholder value. A fundamental part of risk management is not only understanding the risks a company faces and what steps management is taking to manage those risks, but also understanding what level of risk is appropriate
for the Company. The involvement of the full Board of Directors in setting the Company&#146;s business strategy is a key part of its assessment of management&#146;s appetite for risk and also a determination of what constitutes an appropriate level
of risk for the Company. The full Board of Directors participates in an annual enterprise risk management assessment, which is led by the Company&#146;s Chief Compliance Officer. In the Company&#146;s continuing risk assessment process, risk is
assessed quarterly by a steering committee, comprised of members of management representing our business units and corporate staff. This steering committee focuses on identifying and evaluating company-wide risks in four primary areas: financial
risk, legal/compliance risk, operational/strategic risk and compensation risk. This company-wide risk portfolio is then presented to and evaluated by the Executive Committee, made up of our Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer, Business
Unit Presidents, the Executive Vice President of E-Commerce&nbsp;&amp; Direct Business, Executive Vice President of Human Resources and our Executive Vice President&nbsp;and General Counsel (collectively, the &#147;Executive Committee&#148;). The
findings are then presented to the Board of Directors. In addition to the presentation made to the full Board of Directors at least once a year, the Audit Committee receives quarterly updates on certain risk areas the Board has identified for focus
and the Independent Directors periodically discuss risk management during executive sessions without management present. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">While the Board of Directors has the ultimate oversight responsibility for the risk management process, various committees of the Board
of Directors also have responsibility for risk management. In particular, the Audit Committee focuses on assessing and mitigating financial risk, including internal controls, and receives an annual risk assessment report from the Company&#146;s
internal auditors. As part of its annual executive compensation review in setting executive compensation, the Compensation Committee reviews the Company&#146;s management of executive compensation and retention risks and strives to create incentives
that encourage a level </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">11 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">
of risk-taking behavior consistent with the Company&#146;s business strategy. The Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee assists the Board in fulfilling its oversight responsibilities with
respect to the management of risks associated with Board organization, membership and structure, succession planning for our Directors and named executive officers (&#147;NEOs&#148;), and corporate governance. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><A NAME="tx145578_20"></A>How Nominees to Our Board of Directors are Selected </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Candidates for election to our Board of Directors are nominated by our Corporate Governance&nbsp;and Nominating Committee and ratified by
our Board of Directors for nomination to the shareholders. The Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee does not have a formal policy with respect to diversity, however, it seeks to have a Board of Directors that represents diversity as to
skills, experiences, age, race, gender and ethnicity. The Corporate Governance&nbsp;and Nominating Committee operates under a charter, which is available on our corporate web site at <I>www.officedepot.com </I>under the headings &#147;Company
Information/Investor Relations/Corporate Governance.&#148; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Candidates Recommended by Shareholders.</B>&nbsp;Our Corporate
Governance&nbsp;and Nominating Committee will give due consideration to candidates recommended by shareholders. Shareholders may recommend candidates for the consideration of the Corporate Governance&nbsp;and Nominating Committee by submitting such
recommendation directly to the Committee by mail, as described under the heading &#147;Corporate Governance; Communicating with our Board of Directors&#148; later in this Proxy Statement. In making recommendations, shareholders should be mindful of
the discussion of minimum qualifications set forth in the following paragraph. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Qualifications for Nomination.</B>&nbsp;Our
Corporate Governance&nbsp;and Nominating Committee believes that a Director should possess the highest personal and professional ethics, integrity and values, and be committed to representing the long-term interests of our shareholders. He or she
must have an inquisitive and objective perspective, practical wisdom and mature judgment. We endeavor to have a Board representing a range of experiences in business and in areas that are relevant to the Company&#146;s business and operations. We
believe that Directors with experience in significant leadership positions over an extended period, especially CEO positions, provide the Company with special insights. Because we continuously seek to strengthen our business and to grow by
identifying and developing new markets for our products, strategic expertise, both on a domestic and international level, is important to us. We seek to have Directors with experience as executives, directors or in other leadership positions in our,
or similar industries. We believe that an understanding of finance and financial reporting processes is important for our Directors as the Company measures its operating and strategic performance by reference to financial targets. We seek to have a
number of Directors who qualify as audit committee financial experts, and we expect all of our Directors to be financially knowledgeable. We also seek to have Directors with a strong corporate governance background. Our Company&#146;s success
depends, in part, on its success in growing its businesses outside the United States, thus we also seek to have Directors with a global business perspective. In addition, a Director must have an exemplary reputation and record for honesty in his or
her personal dealings and business or professional activity. He or she also needs to exhibit qualities of independence in thought and action. All Directors should possess strong collaboration skills, have the potential to influence management and
also have the ability to dedicate significant time to service on our Board. A candidate should be committed first and foremost to the interests of all our shareholders. Our evaluation of director nominees also considers the diversity of skills,
experiences, age, race, gender and ethnicity as factors when recommending Directors. Persons who represent a particular special interest, ideology, narrow perspective or point of view would not, therefore, generally be considered good candidates for
election to our Board of Directors. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Methods of Finding Qualified Nominees.</B>&nbsp;Our Corporate Governance&nbsp;and
Nominating Committee identifies nominees in a number of ways. One method is the recommendation of sitting members of the Board of Directors, who personally know and have an understanding of the qualifications of a proposed nominee. A second method
is an awareness of persons who are successful in business, the non-profit sector or a profession, whether personally known to a member of the Board of Directors or not. Such persons are contacted from time to time to ask whether they would be
willing to serve. If they are willing, then the Committee conducts significant </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">12 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">
amounts of due diligence to ensure that a nominee possesses the qualifications, qualities and skills outlined above. The Corporate Governance&nbsp;and Nominating Committee also from time to time
may engage search firms to assist the Committee in identifying potential nominees to our Board of Directors. These firms conduct searches on behalf of the Corporate Governance&nbsp;and Nominating Committee and provide the Committee with names of
potential director candidates. We pay these firms a fee for such services. As mentioned above, our Corporate Governance&nbsp;and Nominating Committee also is open to receiving recommendations from shareholders as to potential candidates it might
consider<I>. </I> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Messrs. Raymond Svider, James Rubin and Justin Bateman were appointed as Directors pursuant to the terms of
the Investor Rights Agreement, dated as of June&nbsp;23, 2009 (the &#147;Investor Rights Agreement&#148;), among the Company, BC Partners, Inc. and certain funds advised by BC Partners, Inc. (the &#147;Investors&#148;), whereby the Investors were
entitled to nominate three directors to the Board and the Company agreed to use all reasonable efforts to cause the persons nominated by the Investors pursuant to the terms of the Investor Rights Agreement to be elected to the Board. In addition,
pursuant to the terms of the Investor Rights Agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Rubin was appointed to the Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee and the Finance Committee and Mr.&nbsp;Svider was appointed to the Finance Committee and the Compensation
Committee and Mr.&nbsp;Bateman is a non-voting observer of the Audit Committee. For more information regarding the Investor Rights Agreement, please refer to our Form 8-K filed with the SEC on June&nbsp;23, 2009. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><A NAME="tx145578_21"></A>Communicating with our Board of Directors </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our shareholders and any other parties interested in communicating with our Board of Directors may contact any member (or all members) of
our Board of Directors, or the Independent Directors as a group, any Committee of our Board of Directors or any Chair of any such Committee by mail. To communicate with our Directors by mail, correspondence may be addressed to any individual
Director by name, to the Independent Directors as a group, to any Committee of our Board of Directors by name or to any Committee Chair either by name or by title. All such mailings are to be sent &#147;c/o Corporate Secretary&#148; to our corporate
headquarters at: 6600 North Military Trail, Boca Raton, FL 33496. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In addition, any person who desires to communicate any
matter specifically and confidentially to our Audit Committee may contact the Audit Committee by addressing a letter to the Chair of the Audit Committee, c/o&nbsp;Corporate Secretary, at our corporate headquarters address. Mark on the outside of the
envelope that the communication inside is &#147;Confidential.&#148; Such communications to our Audit Committee may be submitted anonymously to the &#147;Audit Committee Chair,&#148; in which event the envelope will not be opened for any purpose,
other than appropriate security inspections. Such mailing will be directed to the Chair of our Audit Committee for his or her review and follow-up action as he or she deems appropriate. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">It is our Board of Directors&#146; policy that each of our Directors should attend the Annual Meeting, at which time they are available
to answer questions that may be raised in the question and answer period. At our 2010 Annual Meeting, all Directors were in attendance. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><A NAME="tx145578_22"></A>Related Person Transactions Policy </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our Related Person Transactions Policy (the &#147;Policy&#148;) sets forth the procedures governing the review and approval or ratification of transactions between the Company, on the one hand, and
(i)&nbsp;an executive officer; (ii)&nbsp;director; (iii)&nbsp;an immediate family member of an executive officer or director; (iv)&nbsp;any security holder who is known by the Company to own of record or beneficially more than five percent of any
class of the Company&#146;s voting securities at the time of the transaction; or (v)&nbsp;an immediate family member of such five percent security holder, on the other hand. Persons in categories (i), (ii), (iii),&nbsp;(iv)&nbsp;and (v)&nbsp;are
collectively referred to as &#147;Related Persons.&#148; </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">13 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">This Policy applies to all related person transactions, and under the Policy a &#147;related
person transaction&#148; is any transaction: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In which the Company was or is to be a participant; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In which the amount exceeds $120,000; and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In which any Related Person has, or will have, a direct or indirect material interest. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Including any contribution of $120,000 or more to a charitable organization of which a Related Person is a trustee, director, executive officer or has
a similar relationship. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">No Related Person transaction shall be approved or ratified if such transaction is
contrary to the best interests of the Company. Unless different terms are specifically approved or ratified by the Corporate Governance&nbsp;and Nominating Committee, any approved or ratified transaction must be on terms that are no less favorable
to the Company than would be obtained in a similar transaction with an unaffiliated third party under the same or similar circumstances. All related person transactions or series of similar transactions must be presented to the Corporate
Governance&nbsp;and Nominating Committee for review and pre-approval or ratification. A copy of the Policy is available for review on the Company&#146;s web site at <I>www.officedepot.com</I> under the headings &#147;Company Information/Investor
Relations/Corporate Governance.&#148; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">From time to time the Company may engage in purchase and sale transactions for office
products with BC Partners or its portfolio companies. These transactions are conducted on an arms length basis and are not material to BC Partners. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><A NAME="tx145578_23"></A>Succession Planning </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">At least annually,
the Board&nbsp;of Directors formally discusses CEO and senior management succession with the CEO and also in executive session with only non-management Directors present.&nbsp;The process includes an&nbsp;evaluation of the requirements for the CEO
and each&nbsp;senior management position and&nbsp;the regular review of potential permanent and interim candidates for CEO and senior management positions. The Board is currently undertaking a search process to identify a permanent CEO following
Mr.&nbsp;Odland&#146;s departure in November 2010. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><A NAME="tx145578_24"></A>Code of Business Conduct (Code of Ethical Behavior)
</I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our Board of Directors has adopted a Code of Ethical Behavior for all of our employees. This Code also applies to our
Directors. A copy of this Code may be viewed at our corporate website, <I>www.officedepot.com</I> under the headings &#147;Company Information/Investor Relations/Corporate Governance.&#148; In addition, a printed copy of our Code of Ethical Behavior
will be provided to any shareholder upon written request to our Corporate Secretary at the address for our corporate headquarters listed elsewhere in this Proxy Statement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Company has established the confidential Office Depot Hotline (the &#147;Hotline&#148;) to assist our employees in complying with their ethical and legal obligations and reporting suspected violations
of applicable laws, our policies or established procedures. The Hotline enables our associates, vendors and the public to express their concerns about possible violations of law or our policies without fear of retribution or retaliation of any kind.
It is our express policy that no retaliatory action be taken against any associate for using the Hotline procedure. The Hotline is operated by an independent third party, not by Company personnel. The Hotline can be accessed by either calling the
following toll-free number or visiting the following web site: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>1-866-634-6854 </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>www.odhotline.com </I></B></FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">14 </FONT></P>
