 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">44 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><A NAME="tx145578_39a"></A>Director Compensation </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In December 2009, the Compensation Committee set the compensation of outside Directors at an annual targeted economic value (&#147;annual
retainer fee&#148;) of $200,000, with $75,000 to be in the form of cash and the remainder in the form of restricted stock, which is fully vested at the time of grant as required under the terms of the 2007 Long-Term Incentive Plan. The restricted
stock is granted in a lump sum as soon as administratively practicable following the release of election results from the annual shareholder meeting which is held in April. Directors may elect to defer the time of release or payment and/or the form
of payment of any shares of restricted stock by converting such stock to restricted stock units based on the stock&#146;s closing price on the date of grant. The purpose of this allocation of compensation with the majority of the annual retainer fee
payable in restricted stock is to more closely align the compensation of the Directors with the interests of long-term shareholders of the Company. The reduction in the annual retainer fee from $250,000 to $200,000 was to align the compensation of
the Directors with the median compensation of the boards of directors of the Company&#146;s Peer Group (described in the &#147;Competitive Benchmarking&#148; section earlier in this Proxy Statement). A separate compensation arrangement has been
established for the three Directors added to the Board in 2009 pursuant to the terms of the Investor Rights Agreement in connection with the Company&#146;s transaction with BC Partners.&nbsp;Because of the equity held by BC Partners as a result of
the securities purchase and because the three additional representatives are employed by BC Partners, the compensation of the BC Partners representatives for Board service is paid entirely in cash and paid to BC Partners instead of the individuals.
All cash paid to all of the Directors is payable in equal quarterly installments at the end of each quarter during which the Director served. No deferrals of cash are permitted. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Audit Committee Chair receives additional compensation of $25,000 annually for serving in that role, the Lead Director and the
Compensation Committee Chair each receive additional compensation of $20,000 annually for serving in their respective roles, with all other Committee Chairs each receiving $15,000 annually for serving as chairs of their respective committees.
Previously, the Compensation Committee Chair fee was $15,000 and the Lead Director did not receive a chair fee; however, in order to recognize the substantial work being performed for both positions, the Board approved the change in the annual fee
to $20,000 for each. The additional compensation for services as the Lead Director or as a committee chair must be taken in the form of restricted stock unless the Director elects to convert such stock to restricted stock units. The Compensation
Committee eliminated the use of stock options under the compensation arrangement after reviewing the board compensation levels of the Peer Group and other data provided by the Compensation Committee&#146;s compensation consultant, the Hay Group. By
granting equity compensation to Directors using restricted stock, long-term interest of the Directors in the Company is achieved without the additional risk that is created by an option grant. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In 2010, the Compensation Committee approved the continued use of the stock ownership guidelines for the Directors, which requires that
all Directors, with the exception of the Directors representing BC Partners, own an amount of the Company&#146;s stock equal to one times the annual retainer fee (excluding chair retainer fees) to be achieved within three years from the initial date
of Board service. As of March 4, 2011, the current holdings for each Director is appropriate considering the current market value. As of March 4, 2011, nine of the ten Directors subject to the stock ownership guidelines had satisfied their ownership
requirements. The tenth Director is still within his three-year time frame set forth for compliance. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Directors were not
eligible to participate in the Stock Option Exchange, which is discussed further in the &#147;Long-Term Incentive Plans&#148; section earlier in this Proxy Statement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Following his appointment as Interim Chair and CEO, Mr.&nbsp;Austrian stepped down as Lead Director and his service on all committees of the Board requiring director independence was suspended, but he
continues to serve as a Director and a member of the Finance Committee, and is allowed to attend any and all meetings of the other Board&#146;s committees in his capacity as interim CEO. Mr.&nbsp;Austrian will not receive the cash compensation
portion of the Company&#146;s annual retainer fee for Directors for the period he serves as Interim Chair and CEO; however, he is eligible to participate in the equity portion of the annual retainer fee. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">45 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><A NAME="tx145578_39b"></A>Director Legacy Program </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A predecessor company, Viking Office Products, Inc., established a director legacy program in 1996. Under this program, any member of the
Viking board of directors was permitted to nominate one or more charitable organizations to receive a future charitable contribution from Viking in the amount of $1,000,000. A portion of the gift is made at the time of the Director&#146;s retirement
and the remainder is to be paid at the time of the Director&#146;s death. In order to fund these charitable gift payments, Viking took out a life insurance policy on each Director&#146;s life. In 1998, the Company acquired Viking, and now the
Company is the owner and beneficiary of the policies. Director participants and their estates have no legal right to the policy or its proceeds. The Company uses all of the proceeds of the life insurance policies to fund the charitable gifts
designated by the Director participant. All of the premiums of the life insurance policies have been paid in full and no further premiums are required. There are no additional costs related to the maintenance of this program. After the 2011 Annual
Meeting, Mr.&nbsp;Austrian will be the only remaining participant in this program as he will be the only remaining member of the current Board of Directors who was a member of the board of directors of Viking. Mr. Ault, who is retiring from the
Board effective as of the 2011 Annual Meeting, was a participant in this program. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="tx145578_41"></A>SUMMARY OF EXECUTIVE AGREEMENTS AND POTENTIAL PAYMENTS
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>UPON TERMINATION OR CHANGE IN CONTROL </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We have entered into Employment Agreements, Offer Letters, Retention Agreements and Change in Control Agreements with the Company&#146;s NEOs. Material items addressed in these agreements include the term
of the arrangement (including renewal provisions), the elements of the executive&#146;s compensation, the amounts and benefits payable on various termination events (including a change in control of the Company) and restrictions relating to
non-competition, non-solicitation and confidentiality of information imposed on the executive management, all of which are described in more detail below. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>Key Definitions </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>Cause</I></B><B>.</B> The following actions
constitute &#147;cause&#148; for all respective agreements described in this section. Differences reflect various combinations of the time at which agreements were reached, the level of the position and/or market conditions at the time of the
initial hire: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>Agreements with Neil Austrian, Interim Chair and CEO </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In connection with his appointment as Interim Chair and CEO, the Company entered into a letter agreement (&#147;Letter Agreement&#148;)
and a Non-Qualified Stock Option Award Agreement (the &#147;Option Agreement&#148;), each dated November&nbsp;2, 2010, with Mr.&nbsp;Austrian to reflect the unique nature of the newly created interim position until a permanent CEO is hired by the
Company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Under the Letter Agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Austrian is eligible to receive a monthly salary of $200,000. Mr.&nbsp;Austrian
was also granted a non-qualified stock option to purchase 400,000 shares of common stock of the Company (the &#147;Option&#148;) pursuant to and subject to the terms of the Company&#146;s 2007 Long-Term Incentive Plan (the &#147;Incentive
Plan&#148;). The Option was granted with an exercise price of $4.43, and with such other customary terms as determined by the Compensation Committee under the Incentive Plan and as set forth in the Option Agreement. The Option vested with respect to
one third (1/3)&nbsp;of the shares on the grant date of November&nbsp;2, 2010, and will vest 1/3 on each of the first and second anniversaries of the grant date (each a &#147;Scheduled Vesting Date&#148;), subject to Mr.&nbsp;Austrian, on each
Scheduled Vesting Date, continuing to serve as, (i)&nbsp;CEO through the date of commencement of employment of a successor CEO of the Company (&#147;Successor CEO Event&#148;), and as (ii)&nbsp;a member of the Board of the Directors of the Company,
from and after the employment of such Successor CEO. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Under the Letter Agreement, if Mr.&nbsp;Austrian continues to be
employed as interim CEO through the Successor CEO Event, then as of such date, the Option shall vest (to the extent not previously vested) with respect to 50% of the shares subject to the Option, and the then remaining unvested shares covered by the
Option shall vest, subject to Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s continued services as a member of the Board of Directors on the first anniversary of the Successor CEO Event. In addition, the Option, unless previously forfeited by Mr.&nbsp;Austrian pursuant
to a Forfeiture Event (defined below), shall become 100% vested upon the occurrence of any of the following events: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">if prior to the occurrence of a Successor CEO Event, (A)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s employment as CEO of the Company terminates for any reason other
than because of his resignation or for termination by the Company for good cause or (B)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Austrian has not been re-elected to the Board, despite having offered himself as a candidate for re-election to the Board;
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">following the occurrence of a Successor CEO Event, if Mr.&nbsp;Austrian dies, ceases performing services as a Director upon becoming Disabled (as
defined in the Option Agreement), or has not been re-elected to the Board, despite having offered himself as a candidate for re-election to the Board (other than following the occurrence of a Director Good Cause Event (defined below)); or
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">immediately prior to the date of any &#147;Change in Control&#148; of the Company (as defined in the Incentive Plan). </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Option shall expire on November&nbsp;2, 2017, subject to earlier expiration due to certain termination events as described in
Section&nbsp;2(b) of the Option Agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Notwithstanding any of the foregoing, the unvested portion of the Option, if any,
shall be forfeited without consideration if Mr.&nbsp;Austrian resigns or his employment as CEO is terminated by the Company with good cause, in either case, prior to the Successor CEO Event or, thereafter, in the event of
(A)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s resignation as a member of the Board, or (B)&nbsp;termination for cause (as defined in the Letter Agreement). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Letter Agreement may be terminated by either party with sixty (60)&nbsp;days notice to the other, and will terminate immediately upon Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s death or upon termination of his
employment by the Company for good cause. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>Agreements with Michael Newman, Executive Vice President and CFO </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Company&#146;s Executive Vice President and CFO, Michael Newman, is employed pursuant to the terms of an employment offer letter
agreement dated August&nbsp;22, 2008, which was subsequently amended effective December&nbsp;31, 2008 to bring the agreement into documentary compliance with Section&nbsp;409A of the Internal </FONT></P>

Mr.&nbsp;Newman is also subject to a Non-Compete Agreement that subjects him to various restrictive covenants that can limit his post-employment activity. These include an 18-month non-competition period that bars employment or engaging in any
business for any competitor. Other restrictions include non-solicitation and non-interference provisions. In addition, non-disclosure provisions protect the Company&#146;s confidential information and work product. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Retention Agreement</I>. Under the Retention Agreement between the Company and Mr.&nbsp;Newman dated November&nbsp;4, 2010, Mr.&nbsp;Newman is
eligible to earn a retention payment of up to $1,937,500 (the &#147;Retention Payment&#148;), if he remains actively employed until the last day of the retention period which expires on the date the Company files its Annual Report on Form 10-K for
fiscal year 2011, but no later than December&nbsp;31, 2012 (the &#147;Retention Period&#148;). The Retention Payment is payable to Mr.&nbsp;Newman in two installments as follows as long as he remains actively employed with the Company until the last
day of the Retention Period: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">the first installment of $937,500 shall vest upon the earlier of: the date in 2011 that the Company files its Form 10-K for the 2010 fiscal year, or December&nbsp;31,
2011, and shall be payable to Mr.&nbsp;Newman on the earlier of: within thirty (30)&nbsp;days after the Company files its Form 10-K for the 2010 fiscal year or December&nbsp;31, 2011; and </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If prior to the vesting of one or both installments of the Retention Payment,
Mr.&nbsp;Newman&#146;s employment is terminated: (i)&nbsp;by the Company as a result of a termination for cause (as defined in the Retention Agreement), or (ii)&nbsp;by Mr.&nbsp;Newman for any reason, the remaining portion of the Retention Payment
which has not yet vested shall be immediately forfeited. If Mr.&nbsp;Newman&#146;s employment is involuntarily terminated prior to the end of the Retention Period by the Company for any reason other than cause, any such termination shall result in
an immediate vesting of the remaining portion of the Retention Payment which has not yet vested. Such Retention Payment shall be payable to Mr.&nbsp;Newman in addition to any severance benefits that may be payable to him pursuant to the terms in his
Offer Letter, as amended, upon separation from employment, or as set forth in any then applicable change in control agreement between Mr.&nbsp;Newman and the Company. If, as a result&nbsp;of Mr.&nbsp;Newman&#146;s misconduct, the Company is required
to prepare an accounting restatement due to the Company&#146;s material noncompliance with any financial reporting requirement under the securities laws, the Board may seek recoupment of the Retention Payments. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In addition, Mr.&nbsp;Newman was guaranteed to receive his 2010 bonus under the annual cash bonus plan at his 75% target amount
regardless of Company performance, with such bonus to be payable in 2011 at the time specified for the payment of bonuses generally under the 2010 annual cash bonus plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Change in Control Agreement. </I>The Change in Control Agreement between the Company and Mr.&nbsp;Newman dated December&nbsp;17, 2010 governs the terms and conditions of Mr.&nbsp;Newman&#146;s
employment with the Company for the one year period following the date of a change in control (as defined in the Change in Control Agreement). During this period, if the Company terminates Mr.&nbsp;Newman&#146;s employment other than for cause,
death or disability or if Mr.&nbsp;Newman resigns for good reason (as such terms are defined in the Change in Control Agreement) following the change in control, Mr.&nbsp;Newman will be eligible to receive: </FONT></P>

benefits described in the first two bullets above. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>Agreements with Charles Brown, President, International Division </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Company entered into an Executive Employment Agreement initially dated October&nbsp;8, 2001 with Charles Brown, who was Executive Vice
President and CFO when the Executive Employment Agreement was initially entered into and who was subsequently named President, International Division in 2005, in addition to his role as CFO which he maintained until a replacement was hired for such
position. Mr.&nbsp;Brown&#146;s Executive Employment Agreement was amended as of July&nbsp;26, 2005 to recognize Mr.&nbsp;Brown&#146;s promotion to President, International Division, amended and restated effective December&nbsp;31, 2008 to bring the
agreement into documentary compliance with Code Section&nbsp;409A, and amended as of April&nbsp;26, 2010 to recognize the addition of a special retention bonus in exchange for the elimination of a walk-away right which existed under the provisions
of Mr.&nbsp;Brown&#146;s Change in Control Agreement in effect at the time. The Company is also a party to a Change in Control Agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Brown dated December&nbsp;16, 2010. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">55 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-bottom:0px;"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Executive Employment Agreement</I>. Under the Executive Employment Agreement with
Mr.&nbsp;Brown dated October&nbsp;8, 2001, as amended effective July&nbsp;26, 2005,&nbsp;December&nbsp;31, 2008, and April&nbsp;26, 2010, the agreement term runs for successive one-year periods renewing on July 25</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex"></SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> of each year unless either Mr.&nbsp;Brown or the Company gives at
least 6&nbsp;months prior written notice that the term is not to be extended. Under the Executive Employment Agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Brown is eligible to receive the following: </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">a base salary of $625,000&nbsp;per annum, subject to annual review and upward adjustment by the Compensation Committee; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;Brown&#146;s employment may be terminated by the Company or by Mr.&nbsp;Brown at any time, subject to the terms and conditions of the Executive Employment Agreement. The respective rights and
obligations of Mr.&nbsp;Brown and the Company depend upon the party that initiates the termination and the reason for the termination. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Termination for &#147;cause&#148; or resignation without &#147;good
reason&#148;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

but unpaid amounts under incentive plans and other employee programs); and</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a special retention bonus of up to $3,000,000 to the extent vested as of the termination date, with such special retention bonus to vest $1,000,000 on each of September 14,
2010, September 14, 2011, and September 14, 2012; provided that, Mr. Brown is employed with the Company continuously through each vesting date.</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>

<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>

retention bonus of $3,000,000.</FONT></P></TD></TR>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Restrictive Covenants</I>. Mr.&nbsp;Brown&#146;s Executive Employment Agreement subjects
him to various restrictive covenants that can limit his post-employment activity. These include a 12-month non-competition period that bars employment or engaging in any business for any competitor. Other restrictions include non-solicitation and
non-interference provisions. In addition, non-disclosure provisions protect the Company&#146;s confidential information and work product. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Change in Control Agreement</I>. The substantive provisions of the Change in Control Agreement between the Company and Mr.&nbsp;Brown dated December&nbsp;16, 2010 accord with those described above for
Mr.&nbsp;Newman&#146;s Change in Control Agreement dated December&nbsp;17, 2010. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>Agreements with Kevin Peters, President, North
American Retail Division </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Company&#146;s President, North American Retail Division, Kevin Peters, is employed
pursuant to the terms of an employment offer letter agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Peters, dated September&nbsp;20, 2007, which was subsequently amended effective December&nbsp;31, 2008 to bring the agreement into documentary compliance with Code
Section&nbsp;409A. In addition, the agreement was amended effective April&nbsp;21, 2010 to recognize his promotion to President, North American Retail Division. The Company is also a party to a Change in Control Agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Peters dated
December&nbsp;17, 2010. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Employment Offer Letter Agreement</I>. Under the Employment Offer Letter Agreement with

<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">a target annual bonus for the calendar year prior to the year of termination, if the annual bonus for such year has not yet been paid as of the date of
termination. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt&#146;s severance entitlements are conditional upon his execution of a release
of claims against the Company and its affiliates, successors, and assigns, and his compliance with the terms of that release. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Restrictive Covenants</I>. Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt is also subject to a Non-Compete Agreement that subjects him to various restrictive
covenants that can limit his post-employment activity. These include an 18-month non-competition period that bars employment or engaging in any business for any competitor. Other restrictions include non-solicitation and non-interference provisions.
In addition, non-disclosure provisions protect the Company&#146;s confidential information and work product. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Change in
Control Agreement</I>. The substantive provisions of the Change in Control Agreement between the Company and Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt dated December&nbsp;16, 2010 accord with those described above for Mr.&nbsp;Newman&#146;s Change in Control Agreement dated
December&nbsp;17, 2010. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>Amended Employment Agreement with Steve Odland </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On February&nbsp;19, 2010, the Company entered into an amended and restated employment agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Odland (&#147;Amended
Employment Agreement&#148;) that amended certain provisions related to severance and change in control arrangements and eliminated tax gross-up benefits contained in his Employment Agreement originally dated March&nbsp;11, 2005, as amended on
February&nbsp;28, 2008 (&#147;Previous Employment Agreement&#148;). Specifically, the Amended Employment Agreement, among other things, eliminated Mr.&nbsp;Odland&#146;s ability to terminate his employment for any reason during the 30-day period
immediately preceding the first anniversary of the effective date of the &#147;change in control&#148; triggered by the BC Partners equity purchase. The Amended Employment Agreement also provided for the payment of a cash retention award to
Mr.&nbsp;Odland subject to certain conditions. The Amended Employment Agreement became effective on February&nbsp;19, 2010 for a term ending March&nbsp;11, 2011, which would have automatically renewed for an additional one year period on each
successive March&nbsp;11 unless the Company or Mr.&nbsp;Odland provided 90 days prior written notice that the term of employment should not be extended. Mr.&nbsp;Odland resigned from his position as the Company&#146;s Chair and CEO effective
November&nbsp;1, 2010. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">58 </FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Restrictive Covenants</I>. In the Amended Employment Agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Odland agreed to various restrictive covenants that could
limit certain post-employment activity. These included a two-year non-competition agreement that barred employment or engaging in any business for any competitor, including office products retailers (other than a business selling office products and
supplies as a minor portion of its business). Other restrictions included non-solicitation and non-interference provisions relating to the Company&#146;s employees or employees of any subsidiary, as well as non-solicitation provisions relating to
customers, suppliers and other business relations. In addition, non-disclosure provisions protected the Company&#146;s confidential information and work product. Among other remedies, the Company is entitled to cease making payments under
Mr.&nbsp;Odland&#146;s Amended Employment Agreement in the event he violates his post-employment covenants. </FONT></P>

<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff">
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Bonus</B></FONT></P></TD>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(1)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Retirement is generally treated as a voluntary termination for all programs and agreements except the 2007 Long-Term Incentive Plan (&#147;2007 LTIP&#148;).
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(2)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A description of the vesting provisions for stock options under the 2007 LTIP are included later in the &#147;2007 Long-Term Incentive Plan Vesting&#148; section.
Reflects the value of all unvested stock options based on the closing price of the Company&#146;s stock on December&nbsp;23, 2010. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(3)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Reflects a payment under Mr.&nbsp;Newman&#146;s Employment Offer Letter dated August&nbsp;22, 2008, as amended December&nbsp;31, 2008 and April&nbsp;24, 2010, equal to
the sum of: (i)&nbsp;1.5 times his base salary in effect on December&nbsp;23, 2010, (ii)&nbsp;his 2010 pro-rata bonus at the earned rate, and (iii)&nbsp;the product of 18 and the difference between the monthly COBRA premium on December&nbsp;23, 2010
for the type of group health plan coverage in effect for Mr.&nbsp;Newman on December&nbsp;23, 2010 and the active employee charge for such coverage. In addition, under Mr.&nbsp;Newman&#146;s Retention Agreement dated November&nbsp;4, 2010, he is
entitled to a special retention payment of $1,937,500. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(4)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Reflects a payment under Mr.&nbsp;Newman&#146;s Change in Control Agreement dated December&nbsp;17, 2010 (&#147;Change in Control Agreement&#148;) equal to the sum of:
(i)&nbsp;two times the sum of: Mr.&nbsp;Newman&#146;s base salary (including car allowance) in effect on December&nbsp;23, 2010 and Mr.&nbsp;Newman&#146;s 2010 target bonus, (ii)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Newman&#146;s pro-rated 2010 target bonus,
(iii)&nbsp;the product of 18 and the monthly COBRA premium on December&nbsp;23, 2010 for the type of group health plan coverage in effect for Mr.&nbsp;Newman on December&nbsp;23, 2010. In addition, under Mr.&nbsp;Newman&#146;s Retention Agreement,
he is entitled to a special retention payment of $1,937,500. The cash severance payment for Mr. Newman under the foregoing formula equals $4,662,386. However, this cash severance payment is subject to reduction since the parachute amounts associated
with such payment under Section 280G of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 equal or exceed three times Mr. Newman&#146;s average taxable compensation received from the Company for the five year period ended December 31, 2009. The cash severance
payment would be reduced by the minimum amount necessary so that the 20% excise tax is not triggered. The amount of the reduction for Mr. Newman would be $931,519. After this reduction, the cash severance payment would be $3,730,867.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">61 </FONT></P>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(5)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Under Mr.&nbsp;Newman&#146;s Change in Control Agreement, if his termination is due to death or disability after a change in control, Mr.&nbsp;Newman is entitled to his
pro-rated 2010 target bonus, which is $468,750. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(6)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Reflects a payment under Mr.&nbsp;Newman&#146;s Change in Control Agreement equal to his highest annual bonus earned under the bonus plan with respect to the 2007, 2008
and 2009 fiscal years; provided that, he was employed by the Company at the end of the 2010 fiscal year. Mr.&nbsp;Newman&#146;s highest bonus was earned under the bonus plan during the 2009 fiscal year. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Reflects the value of a 24-month outplacement services package under Mr.&nbsp;Newman&#146;s Change in Control Agreement. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>

<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(1)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Retirement is generally treated as a voluntary termination for all programs and agreements except the 2007 Long-Term Incentive Plan (&#147;2007 LTIP&#148;).
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(2)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;Brown is entitled to a special retention bonus of up to $3,000,000 under his Executive Employment Agreement dated December&nbsp;31, 2008, as amended
April&nbsp;26, 2010 (&#147;Executive Employment Agreement&#148;). The special retention bonus is subject to vesting in three equal yearly installments over the period beginning on September&nbsp;14, 2010 and ending September&nbsp;14, 2012, subject
to Mr.&nbsp;Brown&#146;s continued employment through the vesting dates. The retention award will be paid to Mr.&nbsp;Brown in cash, to the extent vested, upon his termination of employment, but shall be subject to accelerated vesting upon
Mr.&nbsp;Brown&#146;s termination by the Company without cause, voluntary termination for good reason or termination due to death or disability, as these terms are defined in his Executive Employment Agreement. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

Reflects the value of all unvested stock options based on the closing price of the Company&#146;s stock on December&nbsp;23, 2010. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>

2010, (ii)&nbsp;his 2010 pro-rata target bonus, (iii)&nbsp;the product of 18 and the monthly COBRA premium on December&nbsp;23, 2010 for the type of group health plan coverage in effect for Mr.&nbsp;Brown on December&nbsp;23, 2010, and (iv)&nbsp;the
product of 18 and the aggregate monthly premiums on December&nbsp;23, 2010 for the disability insurance, life insurance, accidental death insurance and travel insurance in effect for Mr.&nbsp;Brown on December&nbsp;23, 2010.

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(1)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Retirement is generally treated as a voluntary termination for all programs and agreements except the 2007 Long-Term Incentive Plan (&#147;2007 LTIP&#148;).
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(2)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A description of the vesting provisions for stock options under the 2007 LTIP are included later in the &#147;2007 Long-Term Incentive Plan Vesting&#148; section.
Reflects the value of all unvested stock options based on the closing price of the Company&#146;s stock on December&nbsp;23, 2010. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(3)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A description of the vesting provisions for restricted stock under the 2007 LTIP are included later in the &#147;2007 Long-Term Incentive Plan Vesting&#148; section.
Reflects the value of all unvested restricted stock based on the closing price of the Company&#146;s stock on December&nbsp;23, 2010. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(4)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Reflects a payment under Mr.&nbsp;Peters&#146; Employment Offer Letter dated September&nbsp;20, 2007, as amended December&nbsp;31, 2008 and April&nbsp;24, 2010, equal
to the sum of: (i)&nbsp;1.5 times his base salary in effect on December&nbsp;23, 2010, (ii)&nbsp;his 2010 pro-rata target bonus, and (iii)&nbsp;the product of 18 and the monthly COBRA premium on December&nbsp;23, 2010 for the type of group health
plan coverage in effect for Mr.&nbsp;Peters on December&nbsp;23, 2010. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(5)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Reflects a payment under Mr.&nbsp;Peters&#146; Change in Control Agreement dated December&nbsp;17, 2010 equal to the sum of: (i)&nbsp;two times the sum of:
Mr.&nbsp;Peters&#146; base salary (including car allowance) in effect on December&nbsp;23, 2010 and Mr.&nbsp;Peters&#146; 2010 target bonus, (ii)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Peters&#146; pro-rated 2010 target bonus, (iii)&nbsp;the product of 18 and the monthly
COBRA premium on December&nbsp;23, 2010 for the type of group health plan coverage in effect for Mr.&nbsp;Peters on December&nbsp;23, 2010. The cash severance payment for Mr. Peters under the foregoing formula equals $2,732,052. However, this cash
severance payment is subject to reduction since the parachute amounts associated with such payment under Section 280G of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 equal or exceed three times Mr. Peters&#146; average taxable compensation received from the
Company for the five year period ended December 31, 2009. The cash severance payment would be reduced by the minimum amount necessary so that the 20% excise tax is not triggered. The amount of the reduction for Mr. Peters would be $1,090,057. After
this reduction, the cash severance payment would be $1,641,995. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(6)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Under Mr.&nbsp;Peters&#146; Change in Control Agreement, if his termination is due to death or disability after the change in control, Mr.&nbsp;Peters is entitled to
his pro-rated 2010 target bonus, which is $468,750. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">65 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(7)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Reflects a payment under Mr.&nbsp;Peters&#146; Change in Control Agreement equal to his highest annual bonus earned under the bonus plan with respect to the 2007, 2008
and 2009 fiscal years; provided that, he was employed by the Company at the end of the 2010 fiscal year. Mr.&nbsp;Peters&#146; highest bonus was earned under the bonus plan during the 2009 fiscal year. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Reflects the value of a 24-month outplacement services package under Mr.&nbsp;Peters&#146; Change in Control Agreement. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Reflects a payment under Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt&#146;s Change in Control Agreement dated December&nbsp;16, 2010 equal to the sum of: (i)&nbsp;two times the sum of:
Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt&#146;s base salary (including car allowance) in effect on December&nbsp;23, 2010 and Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt&#146;s 2010 target bonus, (ii)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt&#146;s pro-rated 2010 target bonus, (iii)&nbsp;the product of 18 and the
monthly COBRA premium on December&nbsp;23, 2010 for the type of group health plan coverage in effect for Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt on December&nbsp;23, 2010. The cash severance payment for Mr. Schmidt under the foregoing formula equals $2,724,886. However,
this cash severance payment is subject to reduction since the parachute amounts associated with such payment under Section 280G of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 equal or exceed three times Mr. Schmidt&#146;s average taxable compensation received
from the Company for the five year period ended December 31, 2009. The cash severance payment would be reduced by the minimum amount necessary so that the 20% excise tax is not triggered. The amount of the reduction for Mr. Schmidt would be
$701,782. After this reduction, the cash severance payment would be $2,023,104. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>

Amended Employment Agreement based on his triggering event which occurred as of November&nbsp;1, 2010. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Potential Payments
Upon Termination or a Change in Control </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Steve Odland </B></FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="83%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="10%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" COLSPAN="2" ALIGN="center" STYLE="border-bottom:1px solid #000000"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B>(1)<BR>Involuntary&nbsp;Termination&nbsp;or<BR>Resignation w/Good&nbsp;Reason<BR>Prior To Change in Control
<BR>(w/o Cause)</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff">
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Bonus</B>(2)<B></B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">$</FONT></TD>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(1)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On October&nbsp;24, 2010, Mr.&nbsp;Odland resigned as Chair and CEO of the Company, effective November&nbsp;1, 2010. Pursuant to his Amended Employment Agreement, in
connection with his resignation, Mr.&nbsp;Odland will receive the amount in this column. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(2)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Represents Mr.&nbsp;Odland&#146;s 2010 pro-rata bonus at the earned rate under the terms of his Amended Employment Agreement. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(3)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Under Mr.&nbsp;Odland&#146;s Amended Employment Agreement, he is eligible to receive: (i)&nbsp;the product of 24 and the monthly COBRA premium for the type of group
health plan coverage Mr.&nbsp;Odland was enrolled in on November&nbsp;1, 2010, and (ii)&nbsp;the product of 24 and the aggregate monthly premiums for disability insurance, life insurance, and accidental death and dismemberment insurance coverage
Mr.&nbsp;Odland was enrolled in on November&nbsp;1, 2010. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(4)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Represents the full and immediate vesting of all time-vested long term equity awards. Mr.&nbsp;Odland will have the lesser of: (i)&nbsp;24 months following
November&nbsp;1, 2010, or (ii)&nbsp;the remaining option term to exercise his stock options. Although Mr.&nbsp;Odland had 800,000 stock options at the time of his termination that became immediately vested, they resulted in no value because they
were underwater. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(5)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Under Mr.&nbsp;Odland&#146;s Amended Employment Agreement, he is eligible to receive a special retention bonus of $5,000,000 subject to vesting in three equal yearly
installments over the period beginning on September&nbsp;14, 2010 and ending September&nbsp;14, 2012, subject to Mr.&nbsp;Odland&#146;s continued employment through the vesting dates. The retention award will be paid to Mr.&nbsp;Odland in cash, to
the extent vested, upon his termination of employment, but shall be subject to accelerated vesting upon Mr.&nbsp;Odland&#146;s termination by the Company without cause, voluntary termination for good reason or termination due to death or disability,
as these terms are defined in his Amended Employment Agreement. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(6)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Under Mr.&nbsp;Odland&#146;s Amended Employment Agreement, he is eligible to receive a payment equal to two times the sum of his base salary in effect on
November&nbsp;1, 2010 and his 2010 target annual bonus, with such payment to be no less than $5,200,000. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">69 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><A NAME="tx145578_43"></A>2007 Long-Term Incentive Plan Vesting </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Under the terms of the 2007 Long-Term Incentive Plan, upon termination from employment with the Company, an NEO&#146;s stock options will
vest and be exercisable as follows: If an NEO either involuntarily terminates employment with the Company for any reason other than death, disability, or cause (as defined in the 2007 Long-Term Incentive Plan) or voluntarily terminates employment
with the Company after completing at least five (5)&nbsp;years of service, the NEO&#146;s unvested stock options will be immediately forfeited and the vested stock options shall remain exercisable until the earlier of: eighteen (18)&nbsp;months
following the NEO&#146;s separation date, or the expiration date of the options. An NEO&#146;s stock options will fully vest upon termination from the Company as a result of death or disability and shall remain exercisable until the earlier of:
twenty-four (24)&nbsp;months following the NEO&#146;s separation date, or the expiration of the options. An NEO&#146;s stock options will fully vest upon termination from the Company as a result of retirement (age 60 with 5 years of service) and
shall remain exercisable until the earlier of: ninety (90)&nbsp;days following the NEO&#146;s separation date, or the expiration of the options. All of an NEO&#146;s stock options, including any stock options which were previously vested, will be
immediately forfeited if the NEO is terminated by the Company for cause. If an NEO&#146;s termination from employment with the Company does not satisfy one of these provisions, then the NEO&#146;s unvested stock options will be immediately forfeited
and the vested stock options shall remain exercisable until the earlier of: ninety (90)&nbsp;days following the NEO&#146;s separation date, or the expiration date of the options. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Under the terms of the 2007 Long-Term Incentive Plan, upon an NEO&#146;s termination from employment with the Company, the applicable
restriction period will lapse and an NEO&#146;s restricted stock will vest as follows: An NEO&#146;s restricted stock based solely on the requirement to continue to perform services shall become fully vested: (i)&nbsp;immediately prior to a change
in control (as defined in the 2007 Long-Term Incentive Plan), (ii)&nbsp;as of the NEO&#146;s date of death or disability (as defined in the 2007 Long-Term Incentive Plan), or (iii)&nbsp;as of the date the NEO has both attained age sixty and
completed 5 years of continuous service with the Company regardless of whether the restricted stock was granted before or after the date the NEO satisfied the age and service requirements. An NEO&#146;s restricted stock that contains performance
conditions as a requirement for vesting shall vest: (i)&nbsp;pro-rata at target based on the amount of time that has elapsed from the beginning of the performance cycle through the NEO&#146;s date of death, disability, or retirement (as defined in
the 2007 Long-Term Incentive Plan), and (ii)&nbsp;in full at target as of a change in control (as defined in the 2007 Long-Term Incentive Plan). If an NEO is involuntarily terminated by the Company for cause (as defined in the 2007 Long-Term
Incentive Plan) or if the NEO&#146;s termination from employment does not satisfy one of the circumstances described above, all of the NEO&#146;s restricted stock will be automatically forfeited as of the date of termination. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">70 </FONT></P>

unless otherwise indicated. Except as described below, we know of no person that beneficially owns more than 5% of our outstanding common stock, based solely upon filings made with the SEC. </FONT></P>

ownership of that person, shares issuable upon the exercise of options that are exercisable within 60 days of March&nbsp;3, 2011, are not deemed outstanding for purposes of computing the percentage of ownership of any other person. Applicable
percentage of ownership for BC Partners Holdings, Ltd. (including CIE Management II Limited and LMBO Europe SAS) is based on 351,139,384 shares of common stock, which includes the as-converted number of common shares underlying the shares of Series

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The information regarding CIE Management II Limited, which we refer to as CIE, and LMBO Europe SAS, which we refer to as LMBO was derived from a Schedule 13D filed on
July 2, 2009, jointly by: (i)&nbsp;BC European Capital VIII-1 to 12 (inclusive), each a United Kingdom limited partnership (&#147;Funds 1-12&#148;); (ii)&nbsp;BC European Capital VIII-14 to 34 (inclusive), each a United Kingdom limited partnership
(&#147;Funds 14-34&#148; and together with Funds 1-12, the &#147;CIE Investors&#148;); (iii)&nbsp;BC European Capital VIII-35 SC to 39 SC (inclusive), each a Soci&eacute;t&eacute; Civiles organized under the laws of France (the &#147;LMBO
Investors&#148; and together with the CIE Investors, the &#147;Investors&#148;); (iv)&nbsp;LMBO; and (v)&nbsp;CIE on July&nbsp;2, 2009. CIE is the general partner of, and has investment control over the shares held by, each of the CIE Investors and
LMBO is G&eacute;rant as to, and has investment control over the shares held by, each of the LMBO Investors. BC Partners Holdings Limited, a limited corporation organized under the laws of Guernsey, Channel Islands (&#147;BCHL&#148;), is the
controlling entity of each of (i)&nbsp;CIE; and (ii)&nbsp;LMBO. CIE, LMBO and BCHL are each managed by separate boards of directors. A list of the directors of CIE, LMBO and BCHL is provided on Schedules II, III and IV to the Schedule 13D filed on
July&nbsp;2, 2009 and none of those directors have beneficial ownership of the share held by the Investors. Since CIE, LMBO and BCHL are managed by boards of directors, no individuals have ultimate voting or investment control (as determined by Rule
13d-3) over the shares that may be deemed beneficially owned by CIE and LMBO. We have no further information or knowledge about CIE, LMBO or BCHL. The Investors, CIE and LMBO may be deemed to be a &#147;group&#148; (within the meaning of
Section&nbsp;13(d)(3) of the Securities Exchange Act) and, as such, may be deemed to be beneficial owners of (y)&nbsp;274,596 shares of 10% Series A Redeemable Convertible Participating Perpetual Preferred Stock, par value $0.01 per share and
(z)&nbsp;75,404 shares of 10% Series B Redeemable Conditional Convertible Participating Perpetual Preferred Stock, par value $0.01 per share, of Office Depot, Inc., each Investor, however, disclaims beneficial ownership with respect to the shares
owned by each of the other Investors, CIE and LMBO. None of the Investors own any shares of common stock over which it has sole voting, disposition or investment power. The figures in the table set forth the number of shares of common stock, on an
as-converted basis, owned of record and beneficially owned by the funds including the as-converted underlying shares of Series B Preferred owned by the funds, which are now convertible into common stock. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">73 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="tx145578_47"></A>ITEM&nbsp;2: RATIFYING OUR AUDIT COMMITTEE&#146;S APPOINTMENT OF
DELOITTE&nbsp;&amp; TOUCHE LLP AS OUR INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><A NAME="tx145578_48"></A>Information About Our
Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In accordance with the provisions of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002
(&#147;SOX&#148;), the Audit Committee of our Board of Directors appointed the certified public accounting firm of Deloitte&nbsp;&amp; Touche LLP (&#147;Deloitte&#148;) as our independent registered public accounting firm to audit our consolidated
financial statements and our internal control over financial reporting for the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;25, 2010 and to issue an opinion on management&#146;s report on internal control over financial reporting. Deloitte has audited our
consolidated financial statements each year since 1990. Representatives of Deloitte will be present at our Annual Meeting with the opportunity to make a statement if they desire to do so, and they will be available to respond to appropriate
questions from shareholders. Our Audit Committee also has appointed Deloitte as our independent registered public accounting firm for 2011. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Although our Audit Committee already has appointed Deloitte as our independent registered public accounting firm for 2011 and the vote of our shareholders is not required for this action under Delaware
law or SOX, we request that the shareholders nevertheless ratify this appointment. As a matter of good corporate governance, we are submitting this item for shareholder approval. In the event the we do not receive the required vote the Audit
Committee will consider such vote when appointing our independent registered public accounting firm for 2012. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><A NAME="tx145578_49"></A>Audit&nbsp;&amp; Other Fees </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The fees for our independent registered public accounting firm for professional services rendered in connection with (i)&nbsp;the audit of our annual financial statements as set forth in our Annual Report
on Form&nbsp;10-K for the fiscal years ended December&nbsp;26, 2009 and December&nbsp;25, 2010, (ii)&nbsp;the review of our quarterly financial statements as set forth in our Quarterly Reports on Form&nbsp;10-Q for each of our fiscal quarters during
2009 and 2010, and (iii)&nbsp;the audit of our internal control over financial reporting with the objective of obtaining reasonable assurance about whether effective internal control over financial reporting was maintained in all material respects,
as well as fees paid to our independent registered public accounting firm for audit-related work, tax compliance, tax planning and other consulting services are set forth below. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Ratio of Audit Fees, Audit Related Fees and Tax Compliance Fees To Total Fees paid to our Independent Registered Public

<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">98.71% Audit, Audit-Related</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">and Tax Compliance Fees</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.29%&#151;all other fees</FONT></P>
