<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="border-top:3px double #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="border-top:3px double #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="border-top:3px double #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="border-top:3px double #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="border-top:3px double #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="border-top:3px double #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>Internal Revenue Code Section&nbsp;162 (m)</I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The 2007 LTIP is designed to allow the Compensation Committee to grant awards to covered executive officers that will constitute qualified
performance-based compensation for purposes of Code Section&nbsp;162(m). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Code Section&nbsp;162(m) generally provides that no
federal income tax business expense deduction is allowed for annual compensation in excess of $1 million paid by a publicly traded corporation to its principal executive officer or any of the three other most highly compensated officers (excluding
the principal financial officer), as </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">87 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">
determined in accordance with the applicable rules under the Securities Exchange Act. Under the Code, however, there is no limitation on the deductibility of compensation paid to such officers,
who are referred to as &#147;covered executive officers,&#148; that represents qualified performance-based compensation as determined under the Code which requires, among other things, that the material terms of the plan pursuant to which the
compensation will be paid must be disclosed to and approved by the Company&#146;s shareholders. To constitute qualified performance-based compensation, the compensation paid by the Company to its covered executive officers must be paid solely on
account of the achievement of one or more objective performance goals established in writing by the Compensation Committee while the achievement of such goals is substantially uncertain. Performance goals may be based on one or more performance
measures consisting of business criteria that apply to the covered officer, a business unit, or the Company, a subsidiary or other affiliate on an individual or a consolidated basis, but need not be based on an increase or positive result under the
business criteria selected. The Compensation Committee is prohibited from increasing the amount of compensation payable if a performance goal is met, but may reduce or eliminate compensation even if the performance goal is achieved. Approval of the
2007 LTIP, as amended, by the Company&#146;s shareholders at the Annual Meeting will constitute approval of the material terms of the plan pursuant to which performance-based compensation can be paid as required by Code Section&nbsp;162(m).
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>Vote Required for the Amended 2007 LTIP </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast by the holders of shares of the Company&#146;s common stock present in person or represented by proxy at our Annual Meeting is required for approval of
the amendment to the 2007 LTIP. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>YOUR BOARD OF DIRECTORS RECOMMENDS A VOTE &#147;FOR&#148; ITEM&nbsp;5 ON YOUR PROXY CARD. </B></FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">88 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="tx145578_56"></A>ITEM&nbsp;6: SHAREHOLDER PROPOSAL&#151;SPECIAL SHAREOWNERS
MEETINGS </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">William Steiner of Piermont, New York has advised the Company that he is the owner of 2,500 shares of common
stock of the Company, and has given notice that he intends to present for action at the 2011 Annual Meeting the resolution set forth below. In accordance with the applicable proxy regulations, the proposal and supporting statements, for which the
Company accepts no responsibility, are set forth below. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>Shareholder Resolution: </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">RESOLVED, Shareowners ask our board to take the steps necessary unilaterally (to the fullest extent permitted by law) to amend our bylaws
and each appropriate governing document to give holders of 10% of our outstanding common stock (or the lowest percentage permitted by law above 10%) the power to call a special shareowner meeting. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">This includes that such bylaw and/or charter text will not have any exception or exclusion conditions (to the fullest extent permitted by
law) that apply only to shareowners but not to the management and/or the board. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>Shareholder Supporting Statement: </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Special meetings allow shareowners to vote on important matters, such as electing new directors, that can arise between annual meetings.
If shareowners cannot call special meetings, management may become insulated and investor returns may suffer. Shareowner input on the timing of shareowner meetings is especially important during a major restructuring&#151;when events unfold quickly
and issues may become moot by the next annual meeting. This proposal does not impact our board&#146;s current power to call a special meeting. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">This proposal topic also won more than 60% support at the following companies: CVS Caremark (CVS), Sprint Nextel (S), Safeway (SWY), Motorola (MOT) and R.R. Donnelley (RRD). </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The merit of this Special Shareowner Meeting proposal should also be considered in the context of the need for improvement in our
company&#146;s 2010 reported corporate governance status. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Please encourage our board to respond positively to this proposal:
Special Shareowner Meetings&#151;Yes on 6. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>[This ends the verbatim proposal as received from the Proponent.]
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>*********************************************************** </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Board of Directors&#146; Statement in Opposition: </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Board of Directors recommends a vote<B> AGAINST</B> this proposal for the following reasons: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Board has considered this proposal and believes its adoption is unnecessary because the Company&#146;s shareholders already have the ability to call a special meeting. The Company amended its Bylaws
in February 2010 to allow holders of at least 25% of the Company&#146;s outstanding common stock entitled to vote on matters brought before a shareholder meeting to call a special meeting of shareholders upon written request to the Company&#146;s
Secretary. The Company&#146;s Bylaws previously did not allow shareholders to call a special meeting. When amending its Bylaws to permit shareholders to call a special meeting, the Board carefully considered establishing an ownership threshold that
strikes an appropriate balance between enhancing the rights of shareholders and seeking to avoid the situations that could arise if the threshold were set too low. The Board considered that calling a special meeting of shareholders is not a matter
to be taken lightly and should only be held to cover special or extraordinary events when fiduciary, strategic, significant transactional or similar considerations dictate that the matter be addressed on an expeditious basis, rather than waiting
until the next </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">89 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">
annual meeting. Organizing and preparing for a special meeting involves significant management commitment of time and focus, and imposes substantial legal, administrative and distribution costs.
The Board concluded that setting the threshold too low carries a risk of frequent meeting requests, potentially covering agenda items relevant to particular constituencies as opposed to shareholders generally, with attendant significant cost,
management distraction and diversion of management and financial resources. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Board believes that adopting this proposal is
not in the best interest of the Company or its shareholders, since it would permit any holder of ten percent of the Company&#146;s shares to call special shareholder meetings for any reason, at any time and as frequently as they desire. As discussed
above, the Board believes that a 25&nbsp;% ownership threshold is more appropriate because there are several institutions that own more than 5 percent of the Company&#146;s shares. The higher threshold will deter nuisance requests and force
shareholders to seek broader support before requiring the Company to incur the expense of holding a special meeting. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">This
proposal should also be evaluated in the context of the Company&#146;s overall corporate governance profile. The Company is committed to strong corporate governance policies and has implemented a number of policies and procedures in the past that
evidence our commitment. Indeed, the Board believes that the Company&#146;s governance track record is exemplary. As described elsewhere in this Proxy Statement, the Board believes in strong and independent Directors. In fact, our Corporate
Governance Guidelines require that a majority of our Board must be &#147;Independent Directors&#148; within the meaning of the New York Stock Exchange&#146;s listing standards, and all Directors who sit on our Corporate Governance&nbsp;and
Nominating Committee, Audit Committee, and Compensation Committee are Independent Directors. The Company also has a Code of Business Conduct (or a Code of Ethical Behavior) that applies to our Directors and to all our employees which is posted on
our corporate website. Our Corporate Governance Guidelines and our Committee Charters are available on our corporate web site, and we also provide a mechanism for any shareholder to communicate directly with our Board in writing. Finally, each of
our Directors in an uncontested election of Directors must be elected by a &#147;majority of the votes cast&#148; standard. This means that the number of votes cast &#147;for&#148; a Director nominee must exceed the number of votes
&#147;against&#148; the nominee. In light of the Board&#146;s continuing commitment to ensuring effective corporate governance, as evidenced by the actions described above and elsewhere in this Proxy Statement, the Board believes that adoption of
this proposal is not necessary and could be disruptive of the Company&#146;s operations and possibly allow special interests of individual shareholders to exert undue influence. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>FOR THE REASONS STATED ABOVE, YOUR BOARD OF DIRECTORS RECOMMENDS A VOTE &#147;AGAINST&#148; ITEM&nbsp;6 ON YOUR PROXY CARD. </B></FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">90 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="tx145578_57"></A>SECTION&nbsp;16(a) BENEFICIAL OWNERSHIP REPORTING COMPLIANCE
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Section&nbsp;16(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 requires our Directors, executive officers and persons who own
more than 10% of Office Depot&#146;s common stock to file reports of their holdings and transactions of Office Depot common stock with the SEC and the NYSE. Based on our records, we believe that each of our officers and Directors reported on a
timely basis all transactions required to be reported by Section&nbsp;16(a) during fiscal 2010. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="tx145578_58"></A>COPIES OF FORM&nbsp;10-K AVAILABLE </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We filed our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December&nbsp;25, 2010 with the SEC on February&nbsp;22, 2011. The Annual
Report on Form 10-K, including all exhibits, can be found on the Company&#146;s website: <I>www.officedepot.com</I> and can be downloaded free of charge. We will provide a copy of our Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K for our fiscal year ended
December&nbsp;25, 2010, which includes our consolidated financial statements and notes to our financial statements, to any shareholder upon written request. Requests should be sent to the Department of Investor Relations at our corporate offices,
6600 North Military Trail, Boca Raton, FL 33496. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="tx145578_59"></A>2012 SHAREHOLDER PROPOSALS </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Any shareholder proposal intended to be presented for consideration at the 2012 Annual Meeting of Shareholders and to be included in our
Proxy Statement for that meeting must be received by the Corporate Secretary at our corporate offices, 6600 North Military Trail, Boca Raton, FL 33496, Attn: Office of the General Counsel, on or before 5:00&nbsp;p.m. (Eastern Standard Time) no
earlier than the close of business on December&nbsp;23, 2011 and no later than close of business on January&nbsp;22, 2012. If you wish to submit a proposal to be presented at the 2012 Annual Meeting of Shareholders pursuant to Rule 14a-8 under the
Exchange Act, your proposal must be received by the Corporate Secretary at our corporate offices no later than November&nbsp;11, 2011 and otherwise must comply with Securities and Exchange Commission requirements in Proxy Rule&nbsp;14a-8 in order to
be considered for inclusion in the 2012 Proxy Statement and proxy. If a shareholder desires to bring business before the Annual Meeting that is not the subject of a proposal timely submitted for inclusion in the Proxy Statement, written notice of
such business, as prescribed in the Company&#146;s Bylaws, must be received by the Company at its principal office on or before January&nbsp;22, 2012. If the Company does not receive timely notice, such business will be excluded from consideration
at the meeting. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="tx145578_60"></A>OTHER MATTERS </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">It is not presently expected that any matters other than those discussed herein will be brought before our Annual Meeting. If, however,
other matters do come before the Meeting, it is the intention of the persons named as representatives in the accompanying proxy to vote in accordance with the recommendation of our Board of Directors. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">91 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>APPENDIX A </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>FORM OF FIRST AMENDMENT TO THE </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>OFFICE DEPOT, INC. </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>2007 LONG-TERM INCENTIVE PLAN </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>(As Proposed for the Approval of Shareholders at the Annual Meeting of Shareholders to be held on April 21, 2011) </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>WHEREAS</B>, Office Depot, Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;) established the Office Depot, Inc. 2007 Long-Term Incentive Plan (the
&#147;Plan&#148;) to promote the long-term growth and profitability of the Company and its subsidiaries by: (i)&nbsp;providing certain Directors, officers, and key employees of, and certain other key individuals who perform services for, the Company
and its subsidiaries with incentives to maximize stockholder value and otherwise contribute to the success of the Company; and (ii)&nbsp;enabling the Company to attract, retain, and reward the best available persons for positions of substantial
responsibility; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>WHEREAS</B>, under Section&nbsp;14.1 of the Plan, the Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors of
the Company (the &#147;Compensation Committee&#148;) has the authority to amend the Plan at any time; provided that, no such action shall adversely affect any rights or obligations with respect to any awards previously granted under the Plan, unless
such action is required by applicable law, any applicable listing standards, or the participants consent in writing; and </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>WHEREAS</B>, the Compensation Committee desires to amend the Plan with respect to new grants made under the Plan on or after
April&nbsp;21, 2011 as follows: (i)&nbsp;change the definition of &#147;Change in Control&#148; to be consistent with the definition used under the Company&#146;s recently approved model Change in Control Agreement for executives, (ii)&nbsp;clarify
that actions taken by the Committee will be valid and effective even if members of the Committee are later determined not to have satisfied membership requirements under the Plan or the Committee charter, (iii)&nbsp;increase the authorized shares
under the Plan by 24&nbsp;million, (iv)&nbsp;change the ratio under the available share pool for restricted stock, restricted stock unit, and performance awards from 2:1 to 1.4:1, (v)&nbsp;increase the individual grant limits under the Plan to
recognize a current stock price which is significantly lower than the stock price in effect when the Plan and the individual grant limits were originally adopted in 2007, (vi)&nbsp;provide a Director or a Section&nbsp;16 officer under the Securities
Exchange Act of 1934 (&#147;Section 16 officer&#148;) who voluntarily terminates employment with the Company after completing five years of service or who is involuntarily terminated by the Company without cause, with 12 months, instead of 18
months, following the date of termination to exercise stock options and stock appreciation rights, (vii)&nbsp;provide a Director or a Section&nbsp;16 officer who dies or becomes disabled while still employed with the Company with 12 months following
the date of termination to exercise stock options and stock appreciation rights, (viii)&nbsp;expand the prohibitions on repricing to include cash buyouts and exchanges for different types of awards, and (ix)&nbsp;clarify that if a subsidiary of the
Company ceases to be a subsidiary, then any employee of such subsidiary will be deemed terminated under the Plan unless the employee is transferred to the Company or another one of its subsidiaries. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>NOW, THEREFORE</B>, the Plan is amended as follows effective as of April&nbsp;21, 2011, unless provided otherwise herein: </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The definition of &#147;Change in Control&#148; under Article 2 of the Plan shall be amended by adding the following to the beginning thereof: </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;For new grants made on or after April&nbsp;21, 2011, &#147;CHANGE IN CONTROL&#148; means the occurrence of one of the following
events: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a)&nbsp;if any &#147;person&#148; or &#147;group&#148; as those terms are used in Sections 12(d) and
13(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#147;Exchange Act&#148;) (a &#147;Person&#148;), other than an Exempt Person, is or becomes the &#147;beneficial owner&#148; (as defined in Rule&nbsp;13d-3 under the Exchange Act),
directly or indirectly, of securities of the Company representing 30% or more (the &#147;CIC percentage&#148;) of the combined voting power of the Company&#146;s then outstanding securities; provided, however, that if such Person first obtains the
approval of the Board to acquire the CIC percentage, then no Change in Control shall be deemed to have occurred unless and until such Person obtains a CIC percentage ownership of the combined voting power of the Company&#146;s then outstanding
securities without having first obtained the approval of the Board;&nbsp;or </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A-1
</FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b)&nbsp;if any Person, other than an Exempt Person, is or becomes the
&#147;beneficial owner&#148; (as defined in Rule&nbsp;13d-3 under the Exchange Act), directly or indirectly, of securities of the Company representing greater than 50% of the combined voting power of the Company&#146;s then outstanding securities,
whether or not the Board shall have first given its approval to such acquisition;&nbsp;or </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c)&nbsp;during any
period of two consecutive years, individuals who at the beginning of such period constitute the Board and any new Directors whose election by the Board or nomination for election by the Company&#146;s stockholders was approved by at least two-thirds
of the Directors then still in office who either were Directors at the beginning of the period or whose election was previously so approved, cease for any reason to constitute a majority thereof;&nbsp;or </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(d)&nbsp;the consummation of a merger or consolidation of the Company with any other corporation; provided, however, a
Change in Control shall not be deemed to have occurred: (i)&nbsp;if such merger or consolidation would result in all or a portion of the voting securities of the Company outstanding immediately prior thereto continuing to represent (either by
remaining outstanding or by being converted into voting securities of the surviving entity) either directly or indirectly more than 50% of the combined voting power of the voting securities of the Company or such surviving entity outstanding
immediately after such merger or consolidation, or (ii)&nbsp;if the corporate existence of the Company is not affected and following the merger or consolidation, the majority of the Company&#146;s Executive Committee, or if no such body then exists,
the majority of the Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer and Presidents (or other heads, regardless of title) of the principal operating units of the Company retain their positions with the Company (disregarding any such executive whose
employment terminates for reasons other than due to a termination by the Company without cause or a termination by such executive for good reason) and the Directors of the Company prior to such merger or consolidation constitute at least a majority
of the Board of the Company or the entity that directly or indirectly controls the Company after such merger or consolidation;&nbsp;or </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(e)&nbsp;the sale or disposition by the Company of all or substantially all the Company&#146;s assets, other than a sale to an Exempt Person;&nbsp;or </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(f)&nbsp;the stockholders of the Company approve a plan of complete liquidation or dissolution of the Company. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For grants made prior to April&nbsp;21, 2011,&#148; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The definition of &#147;Committee&#148; under Article 2 of the Plan shall be amended by deleting it in its entirety and replacing it with the following:
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;COMMITTEE&#148; means the Compensation Committee of the Board or such other committee consisting of two or
more members as may be appointed by the Board to administer this Plan pursuant to Article&nbsp;3. The membership of the Committee shall be constituted so as to comply at all times with the applicable requirements of Rule&nbsp;16b-3 under the
Exchange Act, Code Section&nbsp;162(m), and the Listing Standards; provided that, any action taken by the Committee shall be valid and effective whether or not members of the Committee at the time of such action are later determined not to have
satisfied the requirements for membership set forth herein or otherwise provided in any charter of the Committee.&#148; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

&#147;forty-nine million (49,000,000)&nbsp;shares.&#148; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

be replaced with &#147;1.4 shares.&#148;&#148; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

(2,000,000)&nbsp;shares&#148; shall be replaced with &#147;four million (4,000,000)&nbsp;shares.&#148;&#148; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">9)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Section&nbsp;10.7 of the Plan shall be amended by adding the following as a new paragraph at the end thereof: </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;For new grants made on or after April&nbsp;21, 2011, the foregoing paragraph shall be deleted it in its entirety and replaced with
the following: &#147;If a Participant who is a Director or Employee subject to Section&nbsp;16 of the Exchange Act ceases to be a Director or Employee of the Company and its Subsidiaries: (a)&nbsp;by voluntarily terminating employment with the
Company following the Participant&#146;s completion of five (5)&nbsp;or more years of service for the Company and its Subsidiaries, or (b)&nbsp;as a result of an involuntary termination by the Company without Cause or due to Retirement, death, or
Disability regardless of the years of service completed by the Participant as of the date of separation, then: (i)&nbsp;all of the Participant&#146;s Options and SARs that were exercisable on the date of such cessation shall remain exercisable for,
and shall otherwise terminate at the end of, a period of 12&nbsp;months after the date of such cessation, but in no event after the expiration date of the Options or SARs, and (ii)&nbsp;except as provided in Section&nbsp;10.8 hereof with respect to
Directors, all of the Participant&#146;s Options and SARs that were not exercisable on the date of such cessation shall be forfeited immediately upon such cessation.&#148;&#148; </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">10)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Section&nbsp;14.2 of the Plan shall be amended by deleting it in its entirety and replacing it with the following: </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;14.2&nbsp;<I>Amendment of Award Agreement.</I>&nbsp;The Committee may, at any time, amend outstanding Agreements in a manner not
inconsistent with the terms of the Plan; provided, however, except as provided in Sections&nbsp;14.3 and 14.4, if such amendment is adverse to the Participant, as determined by the Committee, the amendment shall not be effective unless and until the
Participant consents, in writing, to such amendment. To the extent not inconsistent with the terms of the Plan, the Committee may, at any time, amend an outstanding Agreement in a manner that is not unfavorable to the Participant without the consent
of such Participant. Except for adjustments as provided in Sections&nbsp;4.3 and 14.4, or in connection with the assumption or substitution of an award in a manner satisfying the provisions of Code Section&nbsp;424(a), or in connection with a
corporate transaction involving the Company (including, without limitation, any stock dividend, stock split, extraordinary cash dividend, recapitalization, reorganization, merger, consolidation, split-up, spin-off, combination, or exchange of
shares), the terms of outstanding awards may not be amended to reduce the exercise price of outstanding Options or SARs or cancel outstanding Options or SARs in exchange for cash, other awards, or Options or SARs with an exercise price that is less
than the exercise price of the original Options or SARs without stockholder approval.&#148; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">11)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Section&nbsp;15.5 of the Plan shall be amended by adding the following to the end thereof: </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;If an Employee&#146;s employment or other service relationship is with a Subsidiary and that entity ceases to be a Subsidiary of the
Company, a termination of employment shall be deemed to have occurred when the entity ceases to be a Subsidiary unless the Employee transfers his or her employment or other service relationship to the Company or its remaining Subsidiaries.&#148;
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

DAYS A WEEK. </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B>VOTE BY INTERNET - <U>www.proxyvote.com</U> </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Use the Internet to transmit your voting instructions and for electronic delivery of information up until 6:00 P.M. Eastern Daylight Time the day before the meeting date. Have your proxy card in hand when
you access the web site and follow the instructions to obtain your records and to create an electronic voting instruction form. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B>ELECTRONIC
DELIVERY OF FUTURE PROXY MATERIALS </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">If you would like to reduce the costs incurred by our company in mailing proxy materials, you can
consent to receiving all future proxy statements, proxy cards and annual reports electronically via e-mail or the Internet. To sign up for electronic delivery, please follow the instructions above to vote using the Internet and, when prompted,
indicate that you agree to receive or access proxy materials electronically in future years. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B>VOTE BY PHONE - 1-800-690-6903
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Use any touch-tone telephone to transmit your voting instructions up until 6:00 P.M. Eastern Time the day before the meeting date. Have
your proxy card in hand when you call and then follow the instructions. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B>VOTE BY MAIL </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Mark, sign and date your proxy card and return it in the postage-paid envelope we have provided or return it to Vote Processing, c/o Broadridge, 51
Mercedes Way, Edgewood, NY 11717. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B>If you vote your proxy by Internet or by telephone, you do NOT need to mail back your proxy card.

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">To elect eleven (11)&nbsp;members of the Board of Directors for the term described in this Proxy Statement.</FONT></TD>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>ADMITTANCE PASS </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>2011 ANNUAL MEETING OF SHAREHOLDERS </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>OFFICE DEPOT, INC. </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Thursday, April&nbsp;21, 2011 </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8:30 a.m. Eastern Daylight Time </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Boca Raton Marriott </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5150 Town Center Circle </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Boca Raton, FL 33486-1013 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">561-392-4600 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>For Security Reasons, You Must Present This Admittance Pass
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>In Order To Enter The Meeting. </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Important Notice Regarding the Availability of Proxy Materials for the Annual Meeting: </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Notice and Proxy Statement and Annual Report on Form 10-K are available at www.proxyvote.com. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt dashed #000000">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">M30362-P06908&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<div style ="BORDER-BOTTOM:2pt solid #000000;BORDER-LEFT:2pt solid #000000;BORDER-RIGHT:2pt solid #000000;BORDER-TOP:2pt solid #000000;MARGIN-LEFT:0px;MARGIN-RIGHT:0px;WIDTH:100%">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>PROXY </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>OFFICE DEPOT, INC. </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>6600 NORTH MILITARY TRAIL </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>BOCA RATON, FL 33496 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>THIS PROXY IS SOLICITED ON BEHALF OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The undersigned hereby appoints Rina Teran, Jennifer Leong and Stephen Calkins as Proxies, each with the power to appoint
her or his substitute, and hereby authorizes each of them to represent and to vote as designated on the reverse side all the shares of common stock of Office Depot, Inc. held of record by the undersigned on March&nbsp;3, 2011, at the Annual Meeting
of Shareholders to be held on April&nbsp;21, 2011 or any postponement or adjournment thereof. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>THIS PROXY,
WHEN PROPERLY EXECUTED, WILL BE VOTED IN THE MANNER DIRECTED HEREIN BY THE UNDERSIGNED SHAREHOLDER. IF NO DIRECTION IS MADE, THIS PROXY WILL BE VOTED &#147;FOR&#148; PROPOSALS 1, 2, 3, 5 AND 7, 1 YEAR FOR PROPOSAL 4, AND &#147;AGAINST&#148; PROPOSAL
6.</B> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">To vote by mail, mark, sign and date your proxy card and return it in the enclosed postage-paid envelope. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(continued on reverse side) </B></FONT></P>
